item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136915026141"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9014013526237","gid://shopify/Product/9014079389917","gid://shopify/Product/9014079455453","gid://shopify/Product/9014079553757","gid://shopify/Product/9014079619293","gid://shopify/Product/9014079717597","gid://shopify/Product/9014079783133","gid://shopify/Product/9014079914205","gid://shopify/Product/9014079946973","gid://shopify/Product/9014079979741","gid://shopify/Product/9014081650909","gid://shopify/Product/9014081716445","gid://shopify/Product/9014081814749","gid://shopify/Product/9014081945821","gid://shopify/Product/9014081978589","gid://shopify/Product/9014082044125","gid://shopify/Product/9014083944669"] givan@givanlotz.com {"customer_since":"2021-02-12 11:27:08","seller_since":"2021-02-12 11:27:11","status":"1"} 27 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136915026141 gid://shopify/Product/9014013526237, gid://shopify/Product/9014079389917, gid://shopify/Product/9014079455453, gid://shopify/Product/9014079553757, gid://shopify/Product/9014079619293, gid://shopify/Product/9014079717597, gid://shopify/Product/9014079783133, gid://shopify/Product/9014079914205, gid://shopify/Product/9014079946973, gid://shopify/Product/9014079979741, gid://shopify/Product/9014081650909, gid://shopify/Product/9014081716445, gid://shopify/Product/9014081814749, gid://shopify/Product/9014081945821, gid://shopify/Product/9014081978589, gid://shopify/Product/9014082044125, gid://shopify/Product/9014083944669 Givan Lötz is a contemporary artist known for his pioneering use of encaustic (wax) painting. His gestural, non-literal “matterscapes” explore nature’s cycles of growth, decay, and renewal, expressing a dialogue between landscape and emotional response rather than literal depiction. Lötz’s work seeks enchantment and resonance in the natural world, creating a personal visual language that reflects both inner states and the regenerative rhythms of the environment. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640675299549 Givan Lötz Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_natasha_evans-2
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136922562781","gid://shopify/Metaobject/136939372765"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013972861149","gid://shopify/Product/9013999042781","gid://shopify/Product/9013999075549","gid://shopify/Product/9013999108317","gid://shopify/Product/9013999141085"] natashaleah@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2021-02-12 11:35:15","seller_since":"2021-02-12 11:35:16","status":"1"} 33 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136922562781, gid://shopify/Metaobject/136939372765 gid://shopify/Product/9013972861149, gid://shopify/Product/9013999042781, gid://shopify/Product/9013999075549, gid://shopify/Product/9013999108317, gid://shopify/Product/9013999141085 Natasha (b. 1978, Zimbabwe; raised in Zambia) is a Lusaka-based mixed-media artist. She holds a BA (Hons) in Illustration from The Arts Institute at Bournemouth and works from her home studio. Her practice blends abstraction and figuration across paper, canvas, and sculptural materials like calabash, cement, and textiles. Natasha explores African identity, womanhood, and the dualities of existence, using metaphor, symbolism, and experimental techniques such as photographic transfers, mark-making, and layering. She has exhibited locally and internationally, including Paris, and continues to develop new work. Lusaka, Zambia gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640738738397 Natasha Evans Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_puleng_mongale-1
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136947106013"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013997732061","gid://shopify/Product/9013997797597"] pulengmongale1@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2021-02-12 12:06:15","seller_since":"2021-02-12 12:06:23","status":"1"} 53 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136947106013 gid://shopify/Product/9013997732061, gid://shopify/Product/9013997797597 Puleng Mongale (b. 1991, Durban, South Africa) is a contemporary visual artist working in photography and digital media. Her practice explores spirituality, identity, belonging, and womanhood, using art to process lived experiences and assert her narrative. Mongale’s work has been featured in exhibitions including Africa Foto Fair, Abidjan (2023); The Fold, London (2021); and Terrains of Possibility, Lagos (2021), as well as online and local group shows. Durban, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640747094237 Puleng Mongale Independent Artist

A 2005 BA Information Design graduate from the University of Pretoria, she uses humour, irony, and satire to explore societal norms. Her practice balances personal curiosity and play with collaborative projects, creating work that entertains and engages audiences. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640711573725 Jana Hamman Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_wessel_hamman-1
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136963162333"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013303476445","gid://shopify/Product/9013304131805","gid://shopify/Product/9013842903261","gid://shopify/Product/9013842936029","gid://shopify/Product/9013843132637","gid://shopify/Product/9013843165405","gid://shopify/Product/9013843198173","gid://shopify/Product/9013843230941","gid://shopify/Product/9013843263709","gid://shopify/Product/9133221839069"] wessel@bigdoor.co.za {"customer_since":"2021-02-12 12:58:11","seller_since":"2021-02-12 12:58:14","status":"1"} 64 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136963162333 gid://shopify/Product/9013303476445, gid://shopify/Product/9013304131805, gid://shopify/Product/9013842903261, gid://shopify/Product/9013842936029, gid://shopify/Product/9013843132637, gid://shopify/Product/9013843165405, gid://shopify/Product/9013843198173, gid://shopify/Product/9013843230941, gid://shopify/Product/9013843263709, gid://shopify/Product/9133221839069 Wessel Hamman (b. 1954, Pretoria) is a painter and designer whose practice explores clarity in visual communication. Using masking techniques, he creates figurative works reminiscent of stained-glass saints and Andy Warhol’s hero worship, portraying both cultural icons and anonymous faces. Juxtaposed with graffiti screen prints, his work interrogates notions of celebrity, accessibility, and relevance in an age of fast fame. Pretoria, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640776749277 Wessel Hamman Independent Artist

gid://shopify/Product/9014108127453, gid://shopify/Product/9014108160221, gid://shopify/Product/9014108192989, gid://shopify/Product/9014108324061, gid://shopify/Product/9014108356829, gid://shopify/Product/9014108389597, gid://shopify/Product/9014108422365, gid://shopify/Product/9014108455133, gid://shopify/Product/9014108487901 Founded by artist Bevan de Wet in 2016, Eleven Editions is a collaborative printmaking studio located in the historic downtown district of Ferreirasdorp, Johannesburg. As an artist-run workshop, we partner with a diverse range of South African and international artists to publish and develop innovative print and paper-based projects. Our studio has a primary focus on etching, relief printing, and various monoprinting media, with a strong emphasis on experimentation and combining different disciplines. We also host regular public workshops in techniques ranging from etching and marbling to bookbinding, fostering a wider appreciation for the printmaking craft. Eleven Editions is proud to have collaborated with many of the country's most respected artists, including Norman Catherine, Walter Oltmann, and Diane Victor. The exceptional works produced in our studio are regularly showcased at major events like the RMB Latitudes Art Fair, connecting our artists with a discerning audience of collectors. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640660979933 Eleven Editions Studios

Madlozi Contemporary Art Gallery is an international, South African-based gallery dedicated to supporting artists across the African diaspora. Founded by curator, filmmaker, and cultural producer Beathur Mgoza Baker, the Black-owned gallery champions diverse cultural, racial, and gender identities, providing a platform for both emerging and established artists. Through exhibitions and events, Madlozi engages with critical socio-cultural, political, environmental, and humanitarian themes, collaborating with communities, non-profits, and creative partners worldwide. The gallery connects collectors and audiences to exceptional artworks, fostering appreciation, cultural dialogue, and the growth of Africa’s creative economy. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640732315869 Madlozi Contemporary Art Gallery Gallery

gid://shopify/Product/9014024306909, gid://shopify/Product/9014024339677, gid://shopify/Product/9014024372445, gid://shopify/Product/9014024405213 Sibusiso Gcaba (b. 1989, Johannesburg) is a photographer whose work spans multimedia, film, and photography. He studied at Market Photo Workshop, Umuzi, Skyrink Studios, and Through The Lense. Gcaba has exhibited locally and internationally, including the Yaounde Photo Festival (Cameroon), FNB Art Joburg Fair, and European shows in Gothenburg and Munich. He is a 2022 Tierney Fellowship Award recipient and participated in the 2023 New York Times Portfolio Review. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640756039901 Sibusiso Gcaba Independent Artist

of Africa Gallery), founded in 2013 in Sitges, Spain, champions contemporary African art and works with artists, collectors, and institutions worldwide. The gallery provides a platform for emerging and established artists to express their narratives and grow their practice. OOA hosts eight annual exhibitions showcasing African artists known for originality and freedom of expression. It has expanded internationally with a London space and, from April, an Olivella, Barcelona residency program offering accommodation, materials, and cultural exchanges to support artistic creation and engagement with collectors and media. Barcelona, Spain gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640744210653 OOA Gallery (Out of Africa Gallery) Gallery

gid://shopify/Product/9014101311709, gid://shopify/Product/9014102163677, gid://shopify/Product/9014102556893 gid://shopify/MediaImage/36786683085021 Established in 2010, Dale Sargent Fine Art is a premier gallery and online platform specializing in fine South African art. For over 15 years, the gallery has offered an extensive collection of works by both established masters and compelling emerging artists. Dale Sargent Fine Art operates a private viewing space in Parktown North, Johannesburg, where visits are available by appointment. This is complemented by a robust online platform, offering collectors access to the collection from anywhere in the world. The gallery also provides a range of specialized services, including expert onsite consulting and personalized art sourcing for both private and corporate clients, assisting them in building and enhancing their collections with significant works. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36786682167517 Dale Sargent Fine Art Gallery

item.title: exhibitor_david_krut_projects-1
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136939274461"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013968404701","gid://shopify/Product/9013968503005","gid://shopify/Product/9013968634077","gid://shopify/Product/9013968732381","gid://shopify/Product/9013968863453","gid://shopify/Product/9013968961757","gid://shopify/Product/9013969092829","gid://shopify/Product/9013969322205"] ame@davidkrut.com 0118804242 {"customer_since":"2021-02-16 10:06:08","seller_since":"2021-02-16 10:06:17","status":"1"} 92 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136939274461 gid://shopify/Product/9013968404701, gid://shopify/Product/9013968503005, gid://shopify/Product/9013968634077, gid://shopify/Product/9013968732381, gid://shopify/Product/9013968863453, gid://shopify/Product/9013968961757, gid://shopify/Product/9013969092829, gid://shopify/Product/9013969322205 Established in 2002, David Krut Projects(DKP) operates across Johannesburg with spaces at Arts on Main and the Blue House in Parkwood. It encompasses galleries, a bookstore, a publishing arm, framing, and educational facilities. The David Krut Workshop (DKW), founded in 2002 and now based at Arts on Main, collaborates with leading artists such as William Kentridge, Deborah Bell, and Maja Maljević to produce fine art editions and unique works on paper. DKP’s exhibitions showcase these collaborations and support emerging and established artists, while its training program nurtures future arts professionals. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640631849181 David Krut Projects Gallery

gid://shopify/MediaImage/36789938127069 Established in 2007, EBONY/CURATED is a leading South African gallery with prominent spaces in Cape Town and Franschhoek. For nearly two decades, the gallery has been dedicated to showcasing contemporary and modern art from the African continent and its wider diaspora. The gallery is renowned for its well-established program, which is committed to both nurturing emerging talent and representing the region's most significant creative voices. Artists represented by EBONY/CURATED have achieved significant international recognition, with works featured in museum exhibitions and held in major public and private collections worldwide. A regular participant in premier art fairs such as Expo Chicago, 1-54 London, and the Investec Cape Town Art Fair, EBONY/CURATED is a key conduit between the vibrant art scene of Southern Africa and the global art market. Cape Town, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36789934686429 EBONY/CURATED Gallery

gid://shopify/Product/9013950578909 Founded in 2009 as an experimental, artist-run initiative in Harare, First Floor Gallery is Zimbabwe’s leading contemporary art space. The gallery combines commercial practice with artist development, education, and social engagement, and has been instrumental in launching the international careers of numerous Zimbabwean and regional artists. In 2020, it expanded to Victoria Falls, Zimbabwe’s leading international destination, to reach broader audiences and support emerging local talent. With its dual locations and dynamic programming, First Floor Gallery continues to champion contemporary art and nurture the growth of Zimbabwe’s creative community. Harare, Zimbabwe gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640668680413 First Floor Gallery Harare Gallery

gid://shopify/Product/9014051307741 For over 25 years, Gallery 2 has been a leading fine art gallery in South Africa, dedicated to showcasing contemporary artists and nurturing emerging talent. Founded as Gallery at the Square and rebranded in 2010, it is now based in Johannesburg’s vibrant Parkwood art district. Renowned for its dynamic program and artist support, Gallery 2 also offers expert art consultancy services for private collectors and major corporate projects. It remains a cornerstone of Johannesburg’s art scene, championing the creativity and vision of South Africa’s visual artists. People" – is a leading Pan-African contemporary art space with locations in Johannesburg and Cape Town. Grounded in African identity, culture, and spirituality, the gallery provides a dynamic platform for artists, collectors, and the public to share stories and creative practices across disciplines, from visual art to dance, poetry, and music. The gallery represents iconic artists such as Dr. Esther Mahlangu, Mam Noria Mabasa, Dr. Willie Bester, and Pitika Ntuli, alongside emerging African talent. Hosting solo and group exhibitions, participating in major art fairs, and collaborating with museums and national galleries, The Melrose Gallery supports artists’ careers while engaging a global audience with vibrant and culturally rooted contemporary art. The gallery showcases contemporary South African artists across various media, supporting young artists and curators while encouraging both emerging and established collectors to invest in art, fostering a sustainable contemporary art ecosystem. gid://shopify/Product/9014015525085 Since 1991, The Artists’ Press has been a leading South African studio dedicated to creating the finest limited-edition prints in collaboration with artists. Founded by Tamarind Master Printer Mark Attwood, the studio specializes in hand-printed lithographs, combining world-class technical expertise with artistic vision. Our commitment to quality is uncompromising. Each original print is created on acid-free paper with the most light-fast inks available. To preserve the integrity and value of every edition, all works are signed and numbered by the artist, and the printing plate or stone is defaced upon completion. As a fully off-grid, solar-powered studio, we are also dedicated to environmental responsibility, demonstrating that world-class art can be made with a conscience. White River, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640767639773 The Artists' Press Studios

art printmaking excellence since 1991, Artist Proof Studio (APS) specialise in arts training, print collaborations, partnerships, sales and distribution of prints. APS is a multi-faceted community-centred organisation that trains talented students in South Africa and other countries in Africa. Our graduates are better positioned to become leading art practitioners in the market. Graduate and alumni artists are proudly represented through APS at art fairs, and reputable art galleries throughout the country and internationally. As a centre of printmaking excellence we attract opportunities to collaborate with prominent South African artists who work with our team of experienced printers to create exciting print editions. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640595247325 Artist Proof Studio Studios

item.description: ["gid://shopify/Product/9013421408477","gid://shopify/Product/9013421506781","gid://shopify/Product/9013421539549","gid://shopify/Product/9013421867229"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013421867229","gid://shopify/Product/9013421539549","gid://shopify/Product/9013421408477","gid://shopify/Product/9013421506781"] hello@somethinggoodstudio.com {"customer_since":"2021-02-16 11:24:05","seller_since":"2021-02-16 11:24:13","status":"1"} gid://shopify/Metaobject/131390275805 gid://shopify/Product/9013421408477, gid://shopify/Product/9013421506781, gid://shopify/Product/9013421539549, gid://shopify/Product/9013421867229 Something Good Studio is a collaborative textile design studio from Johannesburg, founded on the pursuit of a good life. We partner with artists and designers to create stand-out textile pieces that encourage well-being, happiness, and purpose. Our goal is to use art and design to make a gentle, positive impact on the world. Proudly made in South Africa from locally sourced natural fibres, our high-quality textiles are created in limited-edition batches to be enjoyed for a lifetime. Discover our collections online, via select retail stockists, or inquire about our custom design services for special projects. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640759939293 SMTNG GOOD Designers

gid://shopify/MediaImage/36725411578077 131 A GALLERY is an independent art gallery in Cape Town, dedicated to showcasing the best of contemporary South African art. We champion both renowned and emerging artists, offering a dynamic space for discovery and connection. Visit us at our Sir Lowry Road location, where we host monthly solo and group shows in our main gallery and specially curated exhibitions in our Annex space. Beyond our exhibitions, we offer a suite of personalized services for collectors. We can help you curate the perfect collection for your home or office, arrange intimate studio visits with our extensive network of artists, and manage all local and international shipping logistics to ensure your artwork arrives safely and on time. Whether you are a seasoned collector or just beginning your journey, we invite you to explore the vibrant world of South African contemporary art with us. Cape Town, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36725559394525 131 A Gallery Gallery

integrity and commitment to South African contemporary art. The gallery showcases both established and emerging artists, offering collectors a balance of innovation and investment value. item.title: exhibitor_guns__rain
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136918073565"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013413118173","gid://shopify/Product/9013413150941"] julie@gunsandrain.com 0762945332 {"customer_since":"2021-02-16 14:17:17","seller_since":"2021-02-16 14:17:19","status":"1"} 158 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136918073565 gid://shopify/Product/9013413118173, gid://shopify/Product/9013413150941 gid://shopify/MediaImage/36790409756893 Founded in 2014, Guns & Rain was among the first online platforms for contemporary African art, created to counter the continent’s under-representation in the global digital space. Now based both online and in Johannesburg, the gallery focuses on emerging artists from Southern Africa and beyond who engage with themes of identity, culture, and social change. Named after anthropologist David Lan’s Guns and Rain, the gallery reflects ideas of struggle, land, and transformation, offering a vital platform for the next generation of African voices in contemporary art. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36790408675549 Guns & Rain Gallery

item.title: exhibitor_99_loop_gallery
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136935440605","gid://shopify/Metaobject/136965062877"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9014065332445","gid://shopify/Product/9014065266909","gid://shopify/Product/9014065529053","gid://shopify/Product/9014065463517","gid://shopify/Product/9013849260253","gid://shopify/Product/9013849227485"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9014065529053","gid://shopify/Product/9014065463517","gid://shopify/Product/9014065332445","gid://shopify/Product/9014065266909","gid://shopify/Product/9013849227485"] gallery@99loop.co.za 0214223766 {"customer_since":"2021-02-16 14:22:42","seller_since":"2021-02-16 14:22:42","status":"1"} 161 ["gid:\/\/shopify\/Metaobject\/136935440605","gid:\/\/shopify\/Metaobject\/136965062877"] ["gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014065332445","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014065266909","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014065529053","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014065463517","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013849260253","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013849227485"] 99 Loop Gallery is a contemporary art space founded in 2015 and based in Cape Town, South Africa. The gallery operates on the belief that it should be a dynamic space for discovery—one that challenges convention and contributes to the evolving dialogue of contemporary art. It has a particular curatorial focus on painting and prioritises collaboration with both established and emerging local talent. Functioning as an accessible platform, 99 Loop supports creatives whose practices engage with intimate lived experiences situated within larger cultural and aesthetic contexts. Through its rotating exhibition program of solo and group shows, the gallery is a space dedicated to presenting fresh, subversive, and essential voices shaping South African art today. Cape Town, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36725415182557 99 Loop Gallery Gallery

gid://shopify/Product/9013451751645, gid://shopify/Product/9013451817181, gid://shopify/Product/9013451882717, gid://shopify/Product/9013451981021, gid://shopify/Product/9013452079325, gid://shopify/Product/9013452177629, gid://shopify/Product/9013452210397 gid://shopify/MediaImage/36789900607709 Doyle Wham is the United Kingdom's first and only gallery dedicated exclusively to contemporary African photography. Founded in 2020, the gallery launched with a nomadic program of exhibitions before establishing its permanent London location in 2022. The gallery is committed to celebrating photography in all its forms and, crucially, to developing the global infrastructure for this field. This is achieved through a dynamic program of exhibitions, international collaborations, and events designed to introduce new artists and build a robust collector base. Doyle Wham’s curatorial program has a particular focus on the intersection of photography with culture, fashion, art, and music, representing a roster of leading artists such as Angèle Etoundi Essamba, Trevor Stuurman, and Yannis Davy Guibinga. As a pioneering platform, Doyle Wham is a vital space for the celebration and promotion of the continent's most compelling photographic voices. London, United Kingdom gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640651804893 Doyle Wham Gallery

item.title: exhibitor_stephen_langa
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136955756765"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013457715421","gid://shopify/Product/9013457748189","gid://shopify/Product/9013457780957","gid://shopify/Product/9013457846493","gid://shopify/Product/9013457879261","gid://shopify/Product/9013849030877","gid://shopify/Product/9013849096413"] stephenlanga7@gmail.com 068 126 8933 {"customer_since":"2021-02-26 11:24:18","seller_since":"2021-02-26 11:26:10","status":"1"} 169 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136955756765 gid://shopify/Product/9013457715421, gid://shopify/Product/9013457748189, gid://shopify/Product/9013457780957, gid://shopify/Product/9013457846493, gid://shopify/Product/9013457879261, gid://shopify/Product/9013849030877, gid://shopify/Product/9013849096413 Stephen Langa (b. 1995, Limpopo) is a Johannesburg-based contemporary artist working in charcoal, watercolor, and oil. Trained at Tshwane North College and Artist Proof Studios, his work explores black experiences, personal journeys, and the intimacy of everyday life. Drawing inspiration from artists like George Pemba, Claude Monet, Gerald Sekoto, and Vincent Van Gogh, Langa’s expressive linework and emotive compositions invite viewers to engage deeply with his subjects and stories. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640763314397 Stephen Langa Independent Artist

item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136896676061"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9014011199709","gid://shopify/Product/9014011232477","gid://shopify/Product/9014011265245","gid://shopify/Product/9014011298013","gid://shopify/Product/9014011330781","gid://shopify/Product/9014011363549","gid://shopify/Product/9014011396317","gid://shopify/Product/9014011461853"] skuy24@hotmail.com {"customer_since":"2021-03-11 13:16:03","seller_since":"2021-03-11 13:16:28","status":"1"} 179 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136896676061 gid://shopify/Product/9014011199709, gid://shopify/Product/9014011232477, gid://shopify/Product/9014011265245, gid://shopify/Product/9014011298013, gid://shopify/Product/9014011330781, gid://shopify/Product/9014011363549, gid://shopify/Product/9014011396317, gid://shopify/Product/9014011461853 Alon Skuy (b. 1981, Johannesburg) is an award-winning South African photojournalist and chief photographer for the Sunday Times and The Times. A graduate of The Market Photo Workshop, he has covered major national events, including the 2012 Marikana Massacre, earning multiple local and international awards such as POYI’s Photographer of the Year (2020). His long-term projects include documenting xenophobia in South Africa, soon to be published in book form with James Oatway. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/37088253804765 Alon Skuy Independent Artist

item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136957788381"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013354430685","gid://shopify/Product/9013425635549","gid://shopify/Product/9013443526877","gid://shopify/Product/9013452275933","gid://shopify/Product/9013959164125","gid://shopify/Product/9014036922589","gid://shopify/Product/9014036955357","gid://shopify/Product/9014036988125","gid://shopify/Product/9014037086429","gid://shopify/Product/9014037119197","gid://shopify/Product/9014037250269","gid://shopify/Product/9014037283037"] tessa@tessateixeira.com (082) 3394848 {"customer_since":"2021-04-21 08:45:09","seller_since":"2021-04-21 08:46:02","status":"1"} 252 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136957788381 gid://shopify/Product/9013354430685, gid://shopify/Product/9013425635549, gid://shopify/Product/9013443526877, gid://shopify/Product/9013452275933, gid://shopify/Product/9013959164125, gid://shopify/Product/9014036922589, gid://shopify/Product/9014036955357, gid://shopify/Product/9014036988125, gid://shopify/Product/9014037086429, gid://shopify/Product/9014037119197, gid://shopify/Product/9014037250269, gid://shopify/Product/9014037283037 Tessa Teixeira (b. 1969, Ermelo, South Africa) studied Primary Education with a major in Art at the University of the Witwatersrand (1991). In her twenties and thirties, she worked in housing and rural development, founding an NGO that built two schools and later serving with the Mineworkers Development Agency. Since 2006, she has focused on her art practice, pursuing further training in San Francisco and London. Her work explores existential philosophy, ecology, and climate narratives through mixed media, painting, installation, and printmaking. She has exhibited widely in South Africa, the USA, and Europe, including 1.5 Degrees (Berlin, 2021), What’s Next for Earth? (Stanford, 2021), Enviro Art Gallery (Duke University, 2021), Amref Artball (New York, 2019), Optimism (New York, 2018), Art of Lithography (WAM), and her solo exhibition Nothing Stands Still (Johannesburg Holocaust & Genocide Centre, 2018). Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640766329053 Tessa Teixeira Independent Artist

He trained at the Cape Town School of Photography and works deeply with traditional darkroom and analog processes—film, photograms, bleaching, dyes—and experiments with “imperfections” (scratches, corrosion, chemical effects) to merge image and process. Slater’s art often explores themes of impermanence, transience, mortality, and nature. His key projects include The Arboretum (2017) and Efflorescent Cherry (2018), the latter published via Quiet Sun Books. His work has appeared in outlets like Od Review, Musée Magazine, and GUP Magazine. Cape Town, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640734904541 Matt Slater Independent Artist

gid://shopify/Product/9014021947613, gid://shopify/Product/9132527419613 Bonita Alice (b. 1962, Johannesburg) is a contemporary South African artist whose practice spans sculpture and mixed media. Her work examines humanity’s fraught relationship with animals and the natural world, exploring how ecological destruction mirrors social injustice and power imbalance. Trained as a sculptor at Wits under Peter Schütz, Alice works primarily in carved wood and in woollen dust on paper—a fragile, tactile medium she developed as an extension of her sculptural practice. Her imagery, influenced by Japanese, Chinese, and Indian aesthetics, often combines beauty and brutality to underscore the tension between violence and delicacy. After 13 years in London, she is now based in Cape Town. Alice has exhibited widely, with work held in major collections including the Johannesburg Art Gallery, Wits Art Museum, and the South African Reserve Bank. She is represented by Everard Read Galleries in London and Cape Town. Cape Town, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640609272029 Bonita Alice Independent Artist

gid://shopify/Product/9014007136477, gid://shopify/Product/9014007169245, gid://shopify/Product/9014007202013 Operating between Cape Town and Durban, Jordan Anthony (b. 1999) is a film photographer, curator, and arts writer who grew up in KwaZulu Natal and graduated from the University of the Witwatersrand, Johannesburg with a Bachelor of Art in Fine Arts. During her studies, she explored subjects in archaeology and psychology, including themes such as healing, dreams, and intuitive creation in her art practice. Anthony has since collaborated with various professionals in the local art industry, including the KZNSA Gallery in Durban (with Strauss & Co.) and Turbine Art Fair (via overheard in the gallery). Her interests also extend into philosophy, memory, and prehistory. South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640717734109 Jordan Anthony Curator

She holds a National Diploma in Fine Arts from Vaal University of Technology and serves on the Visual Arts panel at the National Arts Council. As a curator and mentor, she has led exhibitions including Identify with Me and What Makes Your Heart Fly, exploring themes of identity, life lessons, and artists’ stories. \/9013269823709","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013269790941","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013269659869","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013269627101","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013269594333","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013269561565","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013269528797","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013269496029"] The Billy Monk Collection is the official and sole custodian of the photographic archive of Billy Monk. Operating with the full support of the artist's daughter, Collette Monk, the Collection is dedicated to the preservation and management of this unique body of work. Though physically small, Monk's archive is a vital and irreplaceable document of life in 1960s Cape Town, offering an unfiltered glimpse into a specific time and place. The primary mission of the Billy Monk Collection is to safeguard this important opus and ensure its legacy is preserved for future generations of researchers, curators, and art lovers. The Collection is managed by Gavin Furlonger and Craig Cameron-Mackintosh. Cape Town, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640604291293 Billy Monk Collection Curator

His multidisciplinary practice spans sculpture, video installations, performance, and artistic research, engaging diverse audiences while interrogating history, memory, and decolonial frameworks. Ntuli has exhibited and performed internationally, including the 2016 Kampala Biennale, Bone Performance Festival (Switzerland), and Act Festival (Geneva, Basel, Sierre, Zurich), and participated in residencies at Fondazione Pistoletto (Italy) and Alps Art Academy (Switzerland). Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640745357533 Phumulani Ntuli Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_thato_toeba
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136958607581"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013318516957"] thatotoeba@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2021-08-31 13:12:30","seller_since":"2021-08-31 13:13:10","status":"1"} 327 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136958607581 gid://shopify/Product/9013318516957 Thato Toeba is a Lesotho artist and legal scholar currently called flattendacurve (b.1990, Maseru). She shares visuals of continuing thoughts on personhood, politics, propaganda, nationality, globalisation, law and culture. Her work is influenced by her suspicion of formal things (culture law, politics, institutions,) as sober, objective, neutral tools in resolving growing crises of being here in the world today. She speculates on the intrusion of formal things in the emancipated joy of life, womb to tomb and fantasises about some kind of sweet chaos to be master in a less theorised life. She is a LLD candidate at UWC. Cape Town, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640766951645 Thato Toeba Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_jo_rogge
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136920400093"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013416886493","gid://shopify/Product/9013438841053"] jo.rogge@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2021-09-06 12:33:01","seller_since":"2021-09-06 12:34:33","status":"1"} 335 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136920400093 gid://shopify/Product/9013416886493, gid://shopify/Product/9013438841053 Jo Rogge is a nonbinary multidisciplinary artist working in painting, printmaking, textiles, and sculpture. Their work explores displacement, family lineage, identity, and challenges heteronormative assumptions around gender and sexuality, using personal symbols and intuitive forms. Rogge also draws on experience in human-rights-focused design, having worked with UNICEF Namibia, ARASA, and WHO Namibia. They have exhibited widely, locally and internationally, and founded NJE Collective, supporting female and marginalized Southern African artists, with a current focus on queer narratives. Rogge lives and works between Namibia and South Africa. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640717766877 Jo Rogge Independent Artist

Falata’s work reflects his fashion background, emphasizing bold color, texture, and experimental proportions. item.title: exhibitor_nicola_taylor
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136941043933"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013317861597","gid://shopify/Product/9013318123741","gid://shopify/Product/9013318254813","gid://shopify/Product/9013318353117","gid://shopify/Product/9013318418653","gid://shopify/Product/9014065758429"] Hello@nicolataylorart.com {"customer_since":"2021-09-15 11:21:28","seller_since":"2021-09-15 11:22:04","status":"1"} 342 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136941043933 gid://shopify/Product/9013317861597, gid://shopify/Product/9013318123741, gid://shopify/Product/9013318254813, gid://shopify/Product/9013318353117, gid://shopify/Product/9013318418653, gid://shopify/Product/9014065758429 Nicola Taylor (b.1984) is a visual artist from South Africa. In the context of belonging and connection, Nicola investigates natural laws and matter taking form. Using paint, animation, light installations and sculpture, she explores the human experience from a quantum perspective, looking at unity and identity at a level where manifestation is still physically undecided. Nicola studied in the UK, Italy and South Africa, she has presented five solo exhibitions since 2010, taken part in group shows and collaborations, attended residencies in South Africa and abroad and her work is part of private and public collections. Cape Town, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640741195997 Nicola Taylor Independent Artist

item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136895758557"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013322088669","gid://shopify/Product/9013322186973","gid://shopify/Product/9013367668957","gid://shopify/Product/9013367701725","gid://shopify/Product/9013367800029"] ayivialex@hotmail.fr {"customer_since":"2021-10-14 13:19:29","seller_since":"2021-10-14 13:20:08","status":"1"} 356 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136895758557 gid://shopify/Product/9013322088669, gid://shopify/Product/9013322186973, gid://shopify/Product/9013367668957, gid://shopify/Product/9013367701725, gid://shopify/Product/9013367800029 Alex Ayivi is a French visual artist and printmaker, a graduate of Beaux-Arts de Bourges and ENSAV La Cambre (2018). In 2019, he held Fondation Culture & Diversité’s first residency at Cité Internationale des Arts, presenting his project La MUA. Of Togolese descent, Ayivi explores afrotopia, panafricanism, and family through vibrant works that capture both the exhaustion and serenity of daily life. Paris, France gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640575193309 Alex Ayivi Independent Artist

item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136899035357","gid://shopify/Metaobject/136929771741"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013837955293","gid://shopify/Product/9013844607197","gid://shopify/Product/9013844639965","gid://shopify/Product/9013844672733","gid://shopify/Product/9013844705501","gid://shopify/Product/9013844738269","gid://shopify/Product/9013844771037","gid://shopify/Product/9013844803805","gid://shopify/Product/9013844836573","gid://shopify/Product/9013844869341","gid://shopify/Product/9013844902109"] lawlieart@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2021-10-19 12:21:28","seller_since":"2021-10-19 12:22:23","status":"1"} 358 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136899035357, gid://shopify/Metaobject/136929771741 gid://shopify/Product/9013837955293, gid://shopify/Product/9013844607197, gid://shopify/Product/9013844639965, gid://shopify/Product/9013844672733, gid://shopify/Product/9013844705501, gid://shopify/Product/9013844738269, gid://shopify/Product/9013844771037, gid://shopify/Product/9013844803805, gid://shopify/Product/9013844836573, gid://shopify/Product/9013844869341, gid://shopify/Product/9013844902109 Lorraine Marcus is a South African fine artist with a 30-year career in expressionist painting. Her abstract and figurative work blends emotion, humour, and texture to explore personal experiences, loss, and human expression. Trained under mentors like Lynda Ballen, Phillipa Kotzen, and Gail Mechanic, Marcus works in pastels, oil, and mixed media, creating pieces that convey movement, gesture, and emotional depth. Her art reflects themes of family, maternity, culture, and travel, drawing inspiration from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Europe, Indonesia, and Australia. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640730448093 Lorraine Marcus Independent Artist

gid://shopify/Product/9014034956509 Through The Lens Collective is a Johannesburg-based organization dedicated to nurturing the next generation of contemporary photographers. Established in 2018 and located at the vibrant Victoria Yards, we provide a crucial space for emerging artists to develop their skills, exhibit their work, and connect with a community of practitioners. Our offerings range from advanced photography courses and portfolio reviews to individual mentorship programs. We are committed to creating platforms for visibility, such as our annual Everyday A Woman social media exhibition, which showcases women photographers across Africa. The Collective has gained international recognition for its work, including a special mention at the Rencontres d'Arles Curatorial Research Grants and being featured in Lenscratch’s prestigious ‘Focus on South Africa’. gid://shopify/Product/9133225214173 Ilan Godfrey is a South African visual artist and photographer whose work documents the social, political, economic, and environmental forces shaping contemporary South Africa. He is best known for Legacy of the Mine (2013), which exposed the human and environmental impact of mining, earning him the Ernest Cole Award, and The Platinum Belt (2016), a multifaceted project on South Africa’s platinum sector. Godfrey’s work has been exhibited globally, including at the National Portrait Gallery (London), Iziko South African National Gallery (Cape Town), Wits Art Museum (Johannesburg), and Musée du quai Branly (Paris), and is held in numerous public and private collections. His photography and writings have appeared in The New Yorker, Le Monde Magazine, ZEIT, Guardian Weekend, and Financial Times Magazine. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640692535517 Ilan Godfrey Independent Artist

She holds a BA in Sculpture and Printed Image from Tshwane University of Technology (2010). Her work blends 2D and 3D practices, exploring perception, generational thought patterns, and the ripple effects of human action. Known for her use of negative space, grounded figures, and vibrant textures, her art is held in local and international collections. She has exhibited at Investec Cape Town Art Fair, and been featured in Sasol New Signatures, Thami Mnyele, and Absa Ateliers Art Awards. Currently, she is developing her bronze series Senses and collaborating on Revolve: Redition Four. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640716325085 Jessica Michelle Le Roux Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_keiskamma_art_project
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136923971805"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013350432989","gid://shopify/Product/9013350564061","gid://shopify/Product/9013350629597","gid://shopify/Product/9013350695133"] pippa@pippahetherington.co.za {"customer_since":"2022-05-17 15:02:11","seller_since":"2022-05-17 15:03:09","status":"1"} gid://shopify/Metaobject/136923971805 gid://shopify/Product/9013350432989, gid://shopify/Product/9013350564061, gid://shopify/Product/9013350629597, gid://shopify/Product/9013350695133 Founded in 2000 in Hamburg, Eastern Cape, the Keiskamma Art Project preserves local memory and oral history through large-scale embroidered artworks. The collective has received numerous accolades, including the BASA Award and the Chairman’s Premier Award (2011) for its extraordinary commitment to the arts. Marking its twentieth anniversary, the retrospective Umaf’ evuka, nje ngenyanga / Dying and Rising as the Moon Does at Constitution Hill, Johannesburg, brings together iconic works exploring themes of community, resilience, and healing. In honour of South Africa’s constitutional values — Equality, Freedom, and Human Dignity — the artists have created three limited-edition tapestries reflecting their hopes and lived experiences. Richly detailed and deeply symbolic, the works embody the power of collective creativity to heal and inspire. Eastern Cape, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640720650461 Keiskamma Art Project Non-profit Organizations

item.title: exhibitor_hemali_khoosal
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136916697309"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9133222068445"] hemalikhoosal@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2022-07-28 19:44:58","seller_since":"2022-07-28 19:45:15","status":"1"} 597 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136916697309 gid://shopify/Product/9133222068445 Hemali Khoosal is a socially engaged, multidisciplinary artist and researcher based in Johannesburg. A Fine Arts graduate from Wits School of Art, she also holds a Master’s in Cinematography from Goldsmiths, University of London. Khoosal’s work explores human perception, gesture, language, migration, and intergenerational knowledge through collaborative video, installation, and performance. Her practice has earned numerous awards, including a Commonwealth Scholarship, the Sam Nhlengethwa Young Womxn Award, and the Giovanna Milner Award. She has held residencies at The Spinnerei, Leipzig, and the Bag Factory, and her work is included in collections such as the Centro Luigi di Sarro and the Jack Ginsberg Collection. Her work explores women’s relationships with their bodies, surroundings, and the structures of patriarchy, presenting the female form as a landscape of contestation and imagination. Jacobs’ practice interrogates autonomy, narratives, and the unseen effects of societal systems. She has exhibited at Turbine Art Fair, Bubblegum Gallery, and AfricaNXT, and her work has been featured in publications including Creative Knowledge Resources and African Writer Magazine. item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136912535773"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013356560605","gid://shopify/Product/9013356593373"] dembedavhana@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2022-07-28 20:14:03","seller_since":"2022-07-28 20:14:16","status":"1"} 600 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136912535773 gid://shopify/Product/9013356560605, gid://shopify/Product/9013356593373 (Dembe) Fiona Davhana (b.1996, Thohoyandou, Limpopo) is a multidisciplinary artist based in Johannesburg. She works across painting, doodling, photography, and writing, and is currently pursuing an Advanced Photography course at the Market Photo Workshop. Her work has been featured in publications including Afro-Punk (2016), Odd Magazine (2020), and Heavy Iridescent (2020). She has exhibited with the Through the Lens Collective in shows such as The Portrait Show (2020) and Everyday a Woman (2020), and will participate in Postcard Africa later in 2025. Davhana has completed workshops at MoMA, NEMISA, and Benrose Studios, and was recognized as a Design Indaba Emerging Creative in 2021. She has also facilitated talks, including the Last Thursday Talk for the Dior Photography and Visual Arts Award for Young Talents (2022). gid://shopify/Product/9013939339485, gid://shopify/Product/9013939372253, gid://shopify/Product/9013939405021, gid://shopify/Product/9013939437789, gid://shopify/Product/9013939470557, gid://shopify/Product/9013939503325, gid://shopify/Product/9014064316637, gid://shopify/Product/9014064349405, gid://shopify/Product/9133225279709, gid://shopify/Product/9133225476317 Founded in 1913, Everard Read is Africa's oldest and largest commercial art gallery. For over a century, it has been a premier institution in the South African art world, dedicated to showcasing the country's finest contemporary artists. With seven distinct galleries across four key locations—Johannesburg, Cape Town, London, and Franschhoek—Everard Read offers an international platform for artists from diverse backgrounds. The gallery's mission is to support artists who are committed to contemporary storytelling, exceptional craft, and the making of meaning. It champions work that interrogates both universal and Afrocentric ideas, creating contemporary icons that inspire contemplation, introspection, and awe. Everard Read is committed to the long-term representation of exceptional, established voices while continuously seeking out and nurturing the next generation of talent, ensuring a dynamic and relevant program. Cape Town, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36790004515037 Everard Read Gallery Cape Town Gallery

Using charcoal, panpastel, and acrylic layering, she explores the beauty, fragility, and persistence of nature, often manipulating surfaces to challenge viewers’ perceptions. Allen has exhibited extensively since 2003, with recent solo shows including Evoking Place (Sisonke Gallery, 2023) and Ghostscapes (AVA Gallery, 2020). Her work reflects on the intersections of environment, mental health, and human wellbeing. Cape Town, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640745193693 Philippa Allen Independent Artist

His work is included in the permanent collections of MoMA New York, Zeitz MOCAA, The Frac des Pays de la Loire, The Margulies Collection, and the Iziko South African National Gallery. An immigrant, adventurer, and mother of three, her experiences inform her diverse artistic practice, which spans realism to impressionism. Ros has held multiple solo and group exhibitions, and her work is included in corporate and private collections worldwide. She lives and works in Stellenbosch. item.title: exhibitor_mulanga_mbedzi
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136938324189"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013360459997","gid://shopify/Product/9013360558301","gid://shopify/Product/9013836349661","gid://shopify/Product/9013836415197","gid://shopify/Product/9013836513501","gid://shopify/Product/9013864300765","gid://shopify/Product/9013865054429","gid://shopify/Product/9013865873629","gid://shopify/Product/9014050586845"] mulanga1423@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2022-08-21 17:58:19","seller_since":"2022-08-21 17:58:31","status":"1"} 624 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136938324189 gid://shopify/Product/9013360459997, gid://shopify/Product/9013360558301, gid://shopify/Product/9013836349661, gid://shopify/Product/9013836415197, gid://shopify/Product/9013836513501, gid://shopify/Product/9013864300765, gid://shopify/Product/9013865054429, gid://shopify/Product/9013865873629, gid://shopify/Product/9014050586845 Mulanga Mbedzi is a self-taught visual artist whose charcoal drawings explore healing, self-awareness, and identity. Centering the human figure, her work examines how emotional trauma shapes our self-perception and experience of the world, inviting viewers into a dialogue of honest introspection and personal truth. Holding an LLB from the University of the Witwatersrand and an Honours in Political and International Relations from Rhodes University, Mulanga’s academic background deepened her understanding of social issues. Her practice reflects a commitment to addressing their roots—captured in her guiding belief that “hurt people hurt people.” Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640737263837 Mulanga Mbedzi Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_lusanda_ndita
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136930689245"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013991407837","gid://shopify/Product/9013991801053","gid://shopify/Product/9013991932125","gid://shopify/Product/9013995471069"] lusandandita@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2022-09-16 11:42:19","seller_since":"2022-09-16 11:42:34","status":"1"} 639 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136930689245 gid://shopify/Product/9013991407837, gid://shopify/Product/9013991801053, gid://shopify/Product/9013991932125, gid://shopify/Product/9013995471069 Lusanda Ndita is a South African visual artist. In 2017 Ndita completed the Advanced Programme in Photography course at the Market Photo Workshop in Johannesburg. In 2020 he was awarded the Tierney Fellowship. His practice is one of self-investigation, experienced through the guise of cultivating his family's domestic archive of images, oral narratives and the inclusion of various artefacts, such as an Apartheid dompass book which belonged to his grandfather. His practice serves as a contemporary album which tells the story of his own heritage and life experiences Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640731955421 Lusanda Ndita Independent Artist

Zibaya’s passion for telling stories stemmed from unravelling these layers. As an alumni of the Market Theatre Laboratory, he creates photographs with his cellphone. item.title: exhibitor_leanie_barnard
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136927084765"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013362983133","gid://shopify/Product/9013389295837"] leanie.barnard@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2022-09-26 12:23:55","seller_since":"2022-09-26 12:24:34","status":"1"} 643 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136927084765 gid://shopify/Product/9013362983133, gid://shopify/Product/9013389295837 Leanie Barnard Mentz, born in Pretoria and a graduate of the Open Window Art Academy (2004), is a multidisciplinary artist and floral designer known for her expressive large-scale paintings and drawings. Working with thick layers of paint and charcoal, she explores the fluid boundaries between reality and perception, revealing traces of the human condition through gesture, imperfection, and movement. Her work embraces ambiguity and emotion, reflecting on what we choose to reveal or conceal in a world obsessed with perfection. Pretoria, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640724779229 Leanie Barnard Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_jono_dry
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136921612509"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013363278045","gid://shopify/Product/9013363802333","gid://shopify/Product/9013363867869"] info@jonodryart.com 082 504 4201 {"customer_since":"2022-10-04 11:07:05","seller_since":"2022-10-04 11:08:47","status":"1"} 648 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136921612509 gid://shopify/Product/9013363278045, gid://shopify/Product/9013363802333, gid://shopify/Product/9013363867869 Jono Dry is a self-taught South African artist specializing in large-scale hyperrealist graphite drawings. Each work can take up to two months and 200 hours to complete, reflecting his meticulous approach and devotion to perfection. He produces limited edition Giclée prints from his originals. Exhibiting locally and internationally, Dry pushes the boundaries of graphite, using rich visuals and storytelling to emphasize the passage of time and the emotional power of his work. Cape Town, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640717603037 Jono Dry Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_kirti_ranchod
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136925511901"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013372158173","gid://shopify/Product/9013372190941","gid://shopify/Product/9013372223709","gid://shopify/Product/9013372289245","gid://shopify/Product/9013372322013","gid://shopify/Product/9013372453085"] kirti.ranchod.art@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2022-10-12 11:22:06","seller_since":"2022-10-12 11:22:52","status":"1"} 649 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136925511901 gid://shopify/Product/9013372158173, gid://shopify/Product/9013372190941, gid://shopify/Product/9013372223709, gid://shopify/Product/9013372289245, gid://shopify/Product/9013372322013, gid://shopify/Product/9013372453085 Kirti Ranchod is a neurologist and brain health consultant based in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a special interest in neuroaesthetics and the impact of art on brain health. Her creative journey began at age eight, guided by her father, and has remained intertwined with her medical practice. Drawing on her cultural background and professional experience, Kirti’s art explores the intersections of neuroscience, creativity, and yogic science—examining how visual language and symbols influence perception, and in turn, shape reality. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640721797341 Kirti Ranchod Independent Artist

Africa's leading contemporary art galleries, founded on a passion for empowering artists and fostering meaningful artistic dialogue. Situated in a charming Victorian home in Cape Town, the gallery offers a unique environment where traditional and modern aesthetics converge. This intimate setting provides a nurturing space for artists to grow and for collectors to discover works of exceptional quality. As dedicated collectors themselves, the gallery's team is committed to showcasing artists whose work is relevant, thought-provoking, and impactful. They provide a highly personalized art buying experience, guided by integrity, artistic vision, and a deep appreciation for excellence. With an ever-evolving program of exhibitions available both in-person and virtually, Christopher Moller Gallery invites you to explore the power of contemporary art. item.title: exhibitor_bria_fernandes
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136902869213"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013362655453","gid://shopify/Product/9013362688221","gid://shopify/Product/9013369372893","gid://shopify/Product/9013369405661","gid://shopify/Product/9013369471197","gid://shopify/Product/9013369536733","gid://shopify/Product/9013371273437","gid://shopify/Product/9013371306205","gid://shopify/Product/9013371338973","gid://shopify/Product/9013371470045","gid://shopify/Product/9013371601117","gid://shopify/Product/9013371666653"] bria.fernandes7@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2022-10-26 10:26:21","seller_since":"2022-10-26 10:28:25","status":"1"} 661 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136902869213 gid://shopify/Product/9013362655453, gid://shopify/Product/9013362688221, gid://shopify/Product/9013369372893, gid://shopify/Product/9013369405661, gid://shopify/Product/9013369471197, gid://shopify/Product/9013369536733, gid://shopify/Product/9013371273437, gid://shopify/Product/9013371306205, gid://shopify/Product/9013371338973, gid://shopify/Product/9013371470045, gid://shopify/Product/9013371601117, gid://shopify/Product/9013371666653 Bria Fernandes is a Canadian figurative painter whose work delves into the quiet, often overlooked, spaces of the human psyche. Through her evocative portraits, she explores profound themes of introspection, silence, and the vastness of the unspoken. Her subjects are frequently depicted in moments of passive contemplation or deep reflection, their stillness acting as a powerful gateway for the viewer. By capturing these states of being, Fernandes masterfully examines the delicate nature of vulnerability, the subtle weight of oppression, and the hidden currents of consciousness that lie just beneath the surface. Born in Ottawa, Ontario, and now based in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Fernandes's artistic practice is shaped by a dedicated academic journey. She began her formal training at the University of Manitoba’s School of Fine Art, where she laid the groundwork for her thematic explorations. Currently, she is completing her Bachelor of Fine Arts at the Alberta University of the Arts, further refining her distinctive voice and the conceptual depth of her compelling work. Winnipeg, Canada gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640610484445 Bria Fernandes Independent Artist

Her printmaking explores memory through fluid colour fields, calligraphic marks, and geometric forms that echo fleeting thoughts and architectural spaces. She was awarded the 2022 ABSA L’Atelier Award and presented her debut solo exhibition at Gallery 2 in 2024. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640618840285 Chelsea Selvan Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_eugenie_marais
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136911880413"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013456765149","gid://shopify/Product/9013456830685","gid://shopify/Product/9013457322205","gid://shopify/Product/9014058221789","gid://shopify/Product/9014058287325","gid://shopify/Product/9014058320093"] eugeniemarais@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2022-12-08 19:52:44","seller_since":"2022-12-08 19:54:26","status":"1"} 679 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136911880413 gid://shopify/Product/9013456765149, gid://shopify/Product/9013456830685, gid://shopify/Product/9013457322205, gid://shopify/Product/9014058221789, gid://shopify/Product/9014058287325, gid://shopify/Product/9014058320093 Eugenie Marais is a South African visual artist whose paintings depict everyday scenes—bridges, roads, and landscapes—imbued with nostalgia, serenity, and loneliness. Working in oil, acrylic, collage, drawing, printmaking, and mixed media, she often creates series that explore ideas, experiences, and emotions. Marais has held six solo exhibitions, participated in numerous group shows, and collaborated with The Artists’ Press on lithographs and mono prints. Her work is held in private and public collections. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640661209309 Eugenie Marais Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_dela_anyah
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136908275933"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013985116381"] studio@delaanyah.com {"customer_since":"2022-12-22 08:49:58","seller_since":"2022-12-22 08:54:01","status":"1"} 685 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136908275933 gid://shopify/Product/9013985116381 Dela Anyah is a Ghanaian artist working across sculpture, painting, and installation. Using discarded materials such as inner tubes, tires, and license plates, he explores themes of decay, renewal, and transformation. Influenced by nature and fashion, Anyah weaves rubber into garments and assemblages that reimagine histories and speculative futures of neglected objects. His work is held in collections including the Celine Art Project, Sir David Adjaye, and the Institute Museum of Ghana. Recent exhibitions include Nubuke Foundation, Accra (2023), The Noldor Residency, Accra (2022), and group shows in Tokyo, New York, and Copenhagen. Accra, Ghana gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640641417437 Dela Anyah Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_justin_southey
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136922366173"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013381693661","gid://shopify/Product/9013381726429","gid://shopify/Product/9013410758877"] justinsouthey@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2023-01-11 10:46:56","seller_since":"2023-01-11 10:52:33","status":"1"} 699 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136922366173 gid://shopify/Product/9013381693661, gid://shopify/Product/9013381726429, gid://shopify/Product/9013410758877 Justin Southey is a South African contemporary artist born in 1985, currently based in Cape Town. He graduated cum laude from the Stellenbosch Academy of Graphic Design and Photography in 2007 with a BA in Applied Design, majoring in photography. Southey's artistic practice is characterized by large-scale abstract paintings that delve into themes of nature, spirituality, and the unseen emotional and spiritual landscapes. His works often feature bold swathes of color, texture, and exuberant mark-making, creating a dynamic interplay that invites viewers to explore and interpret the underlying narratives. Eastern Cape, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640717963485 Justin Southey Independent Artist

Her work spans modern abstraction and figuration, seeking harmony through color and form. Narshai holds a BA in Fine Art from Rhodes University, and her work has been exhibited in South Africa, Helsinki, and at the New York Lift-Off Film Festival. item.title: exhibitor_buqaqawuli_nobakada
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136903360733"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013385167069","gid://shopify/Product/9013385298141","gid://shopify/Product/9013960311005","gid://shopify/Product/9013960409309"] buqaqawuliart@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2023-01-30 12:41:36","seller_since":"2023-01-30 12:56:37","status":"1"} 712 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136903360733 gid://shopify/Product/9013385167069, gid://shopify/Product/9013385298141, gid://shopify/Product/9013960311005, gid://shopify/Product/9013960409309 Buqaqawuli Nobakada (b. 2000, Western Cape, South Africa) is an emerging contemporary mixed-media artist raised between Philippi and Lady Frere, Eastern Cape. Working primarily with acrylic on laced paper, often incorporating custom clay or gold jewellery, her practice explores border crossings—both imagined and real. Nobakada is in her third year of Fine Arts at the University of the Witwatersrand and has exhibited in group shows including I Am & Nothing Else (Affinity Art Gallery, Lagos), Everything Was Beautiful and Nothing Hurt (FNB Art Joburg), and the SOMA exhibition in France. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640611401949 Buqaqawuli Nobakada Independent Artist

His semi-abstract, impressionistic style reflects pop culture influences—Britney Spears, Starbucks, Kylie Jenner—while engaging themes of identity, cultural imperialism, and capitalism. A member of the Kutti Collective, he has exhibited in Autumn Salon (Gallery Fanon, Johannesburg, 2021), Kutti Bazaar (A4 Arts Foundation, Cape Town, 2021), and Apartment Vol. 2 (The Fourth, Cape Town, 2020). gid://shopify/Product/9014113075421 Founded in 2020 by artist and curator Lebo Kekana, FEDE Arthouse is a nomadic gallery operating at the intersection of art, design, and culture. Through research-driven and site-specific projects, FEDE explores ‘space-making’ to create alternative, community-oriented exhibition experiences. Collaborating with platforms such as blank projects, Under Projects, and RESERVOIR, FEDE has presented exhibitions across Cape Town and internationally in Ibiza and Barcelona. Rejecting the traditional white-wall format, FEDE embraces a more experimental and culturally engaged approach, using exhibitions as a means to research, connect, and reimagine shared public spaces. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640667402461 FEDE Arthouse Gallery

Working primarily in painting and drawing, his portraits and figures explore vulnerability, emotion, and the experiences of young men navigating life. Using impasto and symbolic motifs like the butterfly, his work reflects themes of hope, change, and self-reflection, inviting viewers to engage imaginatively with his intimate compositions. gid://shopify/Product/9014036889821, gid://shopify/Product/9014037512413, gid://shopify/Product/9014047637725 Khwezi Strydom, born in New Mexico to a South African father and French mother from Tunis, is a painter whose work reflects his fascination with cultural hybridity and identity. Initially drawn to graffiti, skate, and hip-hop culture, he developed a strong foundation in large-scale improvisation and letterforms. After studying astrophysics and training as a glassblower at Cristallerie Saint Louis for five years, he returned to painting full-time in 2012. Strydom currently lives and works in Drôme, France. Drôme, France gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640721633501 Khwezi Strydom Independent Artist

Working across culinary art, sound, and visual media, she investigates human existence alongside technological evolution. Her interests focus on food inequality in South Africa, systemic disparities amplified by private institutions in the 4IR era, and speculative art examining Africa’s role in spirituality and mental health practices. With a background in Communication Design from Rhodes University, he combines journalism and design to create work that speaks to society. Formerly an art journalist for publications like Bubblegum Club and Mail & Guardian, his curatorial approach explores connections between image, text, and space. His multidisciplinary practice spans visual arts, dance, writing, and design, reflecting a deep interest in how art illuminates human experience. She holds a BA Fine Arts (2016) and an MA in Contemporary Curatorial Practice (2020), both with distinction, from Wits University. Her research and practice explore the museum as a pedagogical platform, focusing on immersive exhibition-making, the ideology of display, and the lingering power dynamics of colonial legacies in contemporary museums. Rooted in both village and city contexts, she explores critical cultural placemaking beyond metropolitan centers, questioning the roles of artist, curator, and community in shaping new cultural vocabularies. She is the founder of the Loselo Kultur Network in Kanye, Botswana, and has served on the board of the Kgosi Bathoen II Museum. Basadi holds an MA in Arts Journalism from Syracuse University and a BA in Political Science from the University of Botswana. Botswana gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640601145565 Basadi Dibeela Curator

gid://shopify/Product/9013390442717 Carina Ubisse Capitine is a Mozambican artivist and communications professional who uses art to amplify marginalized voices and drive social change. Her work explores self-reflection, pleasure, and identity in resistance to the invisibilization and objectification of women. As a curator, she focuses on creating access for underrepresented artists and promoting Afro-centric aesthetics. A Fulbright Scholar, she holds a Master’s in Communication and Development Studies from Ohio University and a Licenciatura in Communication Sciences from Universidade Politécnica in Mozambique. She holds an MFA from the University of Belgrade (1999). Her work is rooted in gestural abstraction, starting by “dirtying” the canvas with bright layers of paint and building complex surfaces of drips, blocks, and waves of color. Maljević emphasizes physical movement in her process, creating dynamic compositions that balance conflict and harmony. Working across painting, printmaking, and sculpture, she reinterprets Modernist techniques to suit contemporary needs, aiming for coherence and interplay between all elements in her work. item.title: exhibitor_alexandra_naledi_holtman
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136896151773"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013397127389","gid://shopify/Product/9013427208413","gid://shopify/Product/9013427241181","gid://shopify/Product/9013429698781"] nalediholtman@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2023-04-26 22:26:22","seller_since":"2023-04-26 23:02:36","status":"1"} 794 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136896151773 gid://shopify/Product/9013397127389, gid://shopify/Product/9013427208413, gid://shopify/Product/9013427241181, gid://shopify/Product/9013429698781 Alexandra Naledi Holtman is a Cape Town-based interdisciplinary artist and graduate of the Michaelis School of Fine Art (UCT). Working across sound, sculpture, and interactive installation, her practice explores communication, connection, and perception. Through playful yet conceptually grounded works—such as her interactive sound installation inspired by Roy Ascott’s theory of telematics—Holtman reimagines digital communication through tactile, lo-fi materials. By translating high-tech ideas into intimate, physical encounters, she invites audiences to reflect on the essence of human connection in an increasingly digital world. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640574800093 Alexandra Naledi Holtman Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_cazlynne_peffer
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136904311005"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013398241501","gid://shopify/Product/9013399290077","gid://shopify/Product/9013427077341","gid://shopify/Product/9013427142877"] cazlynne.peffer@up.ac.za {"customer_since":"2023-04-26 22:58:18","seller_since":"2023-04-26 23:07:01","status":"1"} 795 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136904311005 gid://shopify/Product/9013398241501, gid://shopify/Product/9013399290077, gid://shopify/Product/9013427077341, gid://shopify/Product/9013427142877 Cazlynne Peffer – Muffled Violations (2022) is a sculptural and video-based series exploring sexual trauma through found and used objects, including duvets, chairs, and pantyhose. The works embody the intimate effects of rape, using bodily engagement with materials to convey the lingering impact of trauma. Pantyhose, in particular, references both the body and childhood experiences of boundary-based games, linking notions of consent and violation. Through this practice, Peffer transforms everyday objects into vessels of memory and protest, creating a space for empathy, reflection, and alternative narratives of sexual violence within the South African context. The series acts as a personal and social reckoning, reclaiming meaning and opening paths for healing. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640617300189 Cazlynne Peffer Independent Artist

With spaces in Luanda (residencies and talent development) and Lisbon (exhibitions and international exposure), the gallery represents artists like IHOSVANNY, KEYEZUA, KWAME SOUSA, MÁRIO MACILAU, RITA GT, and THÓ SIMOES. MOVART participates in major international fairs and offers consultancy for private and corporate collections while producing cultural projects across Africa and Europe. gid://shopify/Product/9133225935069, gid://shopify/Product/9133226000605, gid://shopify/Product/9133226131677 RESERVOIR, founded in 2021 by Heinrich Groenewald and Shona van der Merwe, is a Cape Town-based gallery and curatorial platform. It hosts solo exhibitions, participates in major international art fairs—including Investec Cape Town, ARCO Madrid, SPARK Vienna, and Artissima Turin—and has won awards such as the Investec Emerging Artist Award and Fundación Banco Sabadell Young Talent Award. The gallery also curates collaborative projects, including Mother City (2024), Disrupting the Dream (2025), Spaced Out (Berlin, 2024), and Fallow Ground (Germany, 2024). Cape Town, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640748601565 Reservoir Gallery

visual arts platform in the Lowveld. Showcasing contemporary fine art from Mpumalanga as well as broader South and Southern African artists, the gallery highlights regional creativity and the cultural significance of art as social, political, and evolutionary expression. Merging with Halifax Art in 2017, White River Gallery emphasizes personal engagement with clients and collectors, fostering transformative experiences through art. White River, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640776782045 White River Gallery Gallery

item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136960475357"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013946056925","gid://shopify/Product/9013946024157"] imbayasarai@gmail.com 0637904793 {"customer_since":"2023-05-16 13:44:13","seller_since":"2023-05-16 13:56:22","status":"1"} 824 ["gid:\/\/shopify\/Metaobject\/136960475357"] ["gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013946056925","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013946024157"] gid://shopify/MediaImage/36790421127389 Imba Ya Sarai is a contemporary art gallery dedicated to showcasing artists from Africa and its global diaspora. Founded to address the challenges faced by even seasoned artists in securing representation, the gallery provides a vital platform for established and emerging voices alike. Through its commitment to inclusivity and sustainability, Imba Ya Sarai connects important African artists with new audiences and collectors, ensuring their continued influence in contemporary art. item.title: exhibitor_thato_tlatsi
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136958640349"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013425373405","gid://shopify/Product/9013425406173","gid://shopify/Product/9013425471709","gid://shopify/Product/9013425537245","gid://shopify/Product/9013425602781","gid://shopify/Product/9013439856861","gid://shopify/Product/9013991047389","gid://shopify/Product/9013992095965","gid://shopify/Product/9013993111773","gid://shopify/Product/9013995503837","gid://shopify/Product/9013995536605","gid://shopify/Product/9014025584861"] ttlatsi999@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2023-06-19 12:46:04","seller_since":"2023-06-19 12:46:44","status":"1"} 846 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136958640349 gid://shopify/Product/9013425373405, gid://shopify/Product/9013425406173, gid://shopify/Product/9013425471709, gid://shopify/Product/9013425537245, gid://shopify/Product/9013425602781, gid://shopify/Product/9013439856861, gid://shopify/Product/9013991047389, gid://shopify/Product/9013992095965, gid://shopify/Product/9013993111773, gid://shopify/Product/9013995503837, gid://shopify/Product/9013995536605, gid://shopify/Product/9014025584861 Tshegofatso Tlatsi (b. 1999, Johannesburg) is a visual artist based in Roodepoort, South Africa. She holds a BA in Fine Arts from the University of Johannesburg (2022) and works primarily in drawing and painting using ink, charcoal, chalk, and acrylic on canvas. Tlatsi’s practice is deeply personal, exploring themes of black femininity, sexuality, mental health, and the complexities of existence. She is particularly drawn to mark-making, embracing the unpredictability of ink and charcoal as metaphors for life, and uses her work to reflect on the interplay between agony, beauty, and free will. Roodepoort, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640766853341 Thato Tlatsi Independent Artist

Her work has been exhibited in London, Paris, Lisbon, and across Cairo, including Gypsum Gallery, Mashrabia Gallery, Darb 1718, and Medrar, and she won first prize in Mohamad Abla’s painting competition in 2015. Baraka’s paintings oscillate between abstraction and surrealism, using vivid colors and expressive brushwork to explore emotional fluctuations and the absurd. Her work often features distorted forms, body parts, and layered compositions, emphasizing fluidity and eruption as a way to narrate complex experiences. New Cairo, Egypt gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640737427677 Nada Baraka Independent Artist

Her work explores spirituality, commemoration, African knowledge systems, and the absence of the black female body in historical narratives. Msezane has exhibited widely in South Africa and internationally, including Zeitz MOCAA, Iziko South African National Gallery, The Royal Ontario Museum, and Oscar Niemeyer Museum. She holds an MFA from Michaelis School of Fine Art, UCT, and has participated in residencies, biennales, and received awards including the Rising Light award at the Mbokodo Awards (2016) and recognition as an OkayAfrica 100 Women Honoree (2018). Cape Town, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640755810525 Sethembile Msezane Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_christine_dixie
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136905523421"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013431730397"] c.dixie@ru.ac.za {"customer_since":"2023-07-28 09:07:05","seller_since":"2023-07-28 09:07:53","status":"1"} 861 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136905523421 gid://shopify/Product/9013431730397 Christine Dixie is an established South African artist whose work explores gender roles, myth, and Europe’s colonial legacy in Africa. Based in Makhanda, she draws on archival imagery and research to create haunting visual narratives that blur the boundaries between past and present. Primarily a printmaker, Dixie often extends her works through embossing, embroidery, books, film, and installation, reflecting her interest in the interplay between text and image. Her art forms part of major collections including The New York Public Library, The Smithsonian National Museum of African Art, The Iwalewahaus Museum, Standard Bank Gallery, Johannesburg Art Gallery, and Iziko South African National Gallery. Makhanda, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640624771293 Christine Dixie Independent Artist

Nkalashe draws inspiration from South African cultural ceremonies, particularly Xhosa traditions, using vibrant patterns and colors from Xhosa, Zulu, and Ndebele heritage to create contemporary, hybrid interpretations of African identity.
