A 2019 BA Photography graduate from the Michaelis School of Fine Art (UCT), Makepe has since gained international recognition, receiving awards and residencies including the Prince Claus Seed Award (2024), FOAM Talent (2024-2025), and the Tierney Fellowship Award (2019). His practice spans photography and multimedia projects, exploring identity, memory, and collective experience. Makepe has presented solo exhibitions such as We Didn’t Choose to Be Down Here (Lemkus Gallery, 2025) and It’s Not Going to Get Better (Vela Projects, 2024–25), alongside participation in prominent group shows locally and abroad, including Art Basel NY and the Botswana Pavilion projects. His work is held in private and public collections, including the University of Cape Town and University of Pretoria. Makepe is a founding member of the Botswana Pavilion collective and works between Gaborone, Cape Town, and Johannesburg. Gaborone, Botswana gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640767574237 Thero Makepe Independent Artist

As a mixed-race individual, her paintings reflect on inclusion, community, and the commonalities that connect people beyond race. Graduating with a BA in Film, Anthropology, and Sociology from the University of Cape Town (2021), she works primarily in acrylics, oil, and mixed media on canvas. Myataza has exhibited at Mullers Gallery, 6 Spin Street Gallery, 91 Loop Street Gallery, and Red Gallery in Cape Town, and has sold over 20 paintings. Her style emphasizes earthy tones and intricate line work, inviting reflection on togetherness, spirituality, and shared identity. Naisula explores human identity, particularly the female experience within the African diaspora, using art to challenge preconceptions and spark dialogue. Her current work addresses sexual abuse and the erosion of individual identity, employing silhouettes and layered mediums to highlight the narratives behind statistics and foster awareness, compassion, and social change. Johannesburg, South Africa) is a visual artist whose work explores identity, mythology, and folklore through painting, video, performance, and digital media. A Goldsmiths University of London graduate (BA Fine Art and History of Art, First-Class Honours, 2020), Tayhe’s practice reflects her mixed-race heritage and draws from South Africa’s Coloured and Indian communities. Her art blends historical archives with fictional narratives to explore creation, displacement, transformation, and fantasy. Selected for the 2021 RMB Talent Unlocked mentoring program and group exhibition at Everard Read CIRCA Gallery, Tayhe continues to exhibit her work locally and internationally. She is currently based in Johannesburg. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640765870301 Tayhe Munsamy Independent Artist

item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136897528029"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9014045573341","gid://shopify/Product/9014045638877","gid://shopify/Product/9014045671645","gid://shopify/Product/9014063136989","gid://shopify/Product/9014063169757"] studio@andrewkayser.com {"customer_since":"2023-12-19 08:53:54","seller_since":"2023-12-19 08:59:10","status":"1"} 910 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136897528029 gid://shopify/Product/9014045573341, gid://shopify/Product/9014045638877, gid://shopify/Product/9014045671645, gid://shopify/Product/9014063136989, gid://shopify/Product/9014063169757 Andrew Kayser (b. 1975, East London, South Africa) is a Johannesburg-based painter whose work explores suburbia as both a lived habitat and a psychological space. Working primarily in oil, he examines ambiguity, contradiction, and fleeting meaning, creating poignant and melancholic reflections on inner and outer realities. A graduate of the Royal Academy of Art, The Hague (2001), Kayser returned to South Africa in 2005 and resumed his practice after overcoming addiction in 2014. He has since held five solo exhibitions, including Fragments of Longer Stories (Graham Contemporary, 2023), and participated in major fairs such as 1-54 (London), AKAA (Paris), and Investec Cape Town Art Fair. His work is held in both local and international collections. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640594460893 Andrew Kayser Independent Artist

item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136944156893"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013845065949","gid://shopify/Product/9013845098717"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013845065949","gid://shopify/Product/9013845098717"] info@16by16.co {"customer_since":"2024-01-19 08:55:48","seller_since":"2024-01-19 08:58:35","status":"1"} gid://shopify/Metaobject/136944156893 gid://shopify/Product/9013845065949, gid://shopify/Product/9013845098717 gid://shopify/MediaImage/37060489937117 16/16, together with the Friends of 16 network, forms an evolving constellation of creators—artists, facilitators, thinkers, and artisans—who coalesce around a shared commitment: building trust, infrastructure, and possibility within Lagos. At our core, 16/16 is both a physical and conceptual aggregator—a site and a catalyst—where ideas, practices, and relationships are free to germinate across disciplines. Since our inception, we have invited members of our carefully curated creative ecosystem (our 'Friends of 16') to activate 16/16 as a centre for mutual learning and collaboration. Through co‐programming, workshops, open studios, residencies and idea prototyping, we've transformed the space into a prototype of shelter: simultaneously a safe harbour as well as a creative vantage point, continuously orienting our ever-growing community toward the untold potential of our urban futures.) Our core mission is to challenge the monolithic categorization of 'African art' by showcasing the continent's immense diversity of cultures, histories, and artistic expressions. Through a program of thought-provoking exhibitions, we address important global issues and work to dismantle preconceived notions, promoting a deeper and more nuanced understanding of the continent. The gallery is a nurturing and supportive platform for talented African artists, providing a space for them to share their unique stories, concepts, and journeys. We are committed to fostering their creative growth and amplifying their voices in the ongoing global dialogue about Africa. We invite you to immerse yourself in the captivating perspectives and connect with the artistic excellence that defines contemporary art from Africa. We are dedicated to showcasing original forms of expression and creating a dynamic environment where collectors can engage with powerful artistic ideas and discussions. Our gallery was established by artist Daudi Karungi, whose firsthand experience informs our artist-centric mission. We are deeply committed to building a supportive and equitable community, actively fostering our artists' careers through dedicated mentorship, strategic visibility, and diligent archiving of their work. This commitment has successfully launched our artists onto the world stage. Works by AAG artists are consistently featured in major museums, biennales, and the world's most prestigious art fairs, including Art Basel Miami Beach, EXPO Chicago, Art Paris, 1:54 Contemporary African Art Fair, and FNB Art Joburg, among many others. item.title: exhibitor_chilli_art_projects
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136922333405","gid://shopify/Metaobject/136901460189","gid://shopify/Metaobject/136948646109"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013850865885","gid://shopify/Product/9013850931421","gid://shopify/Product/9013850964189","gid://shopify/Product/9013850996957","gid://shopify/Product/9013945696477","gid://shopify/Product/9013945729245","gid://shopify/Product/9013945794781","gid://shopify/Product/9013945827549"] aubrey@chilliartprojects.com {"customer_since":"2024-03-13 10:16:41","seller_since":"2024-03-13 10:18:17","status":"1"} 958 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136922333405, gid://shopify/Metaobject/136901460189, gid://shopify/Metaobject/136948646109 gid://shopify/Product/9013850865885, gid://shopify/Product/9013850931421, gid://shopify/Product/9013850964189, gid://shopify/Product/9013850996957, gid://shopify/Product/9013945696477, gid://shopify/Product/9013945729245, gid://shopify/Product/9013945794781, gid://shopify/Product/9013945827549 gid://shopify/MediaImage/36786583634141 Chilli Art Projects is an artist-run contemporary gallery founded in 2021 by artist and collector Aubrey Higgin. From its origins as a nomadic exhibition program, the gallery has grown into a respected voice in London’s art scene, with a permanent space on New Bond Street, Mayfair, and a second location in Cheshire. The gallery’s program is centered on diverse, emerging, international artists, with a particular focus on painting. It is dedicated to showcasing artists who tell untold stories of identity and environment through unique conceptual processes, often providing them with their first major European platform. Since its inception, Chilli Art Projects has championed underrepresented artists, especially those from Africa and its Diasporas, contributing significantly to the conversation around BIPOC+ art. This mission extends to a deep commitment to public access, demonstrated through a regular program of talks, collaborations with institutions like Tate Britain and the Royal African Society, and its own publishing wing, Chilli Press. London, United Kingdom gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640621232349 Chilli Art Projects Gallery

Immersed in cultural and performing arts from a young age, he later studied art and design, cultivating a practice that spans visual art, poetry, music, and curation. A member of the Art of the Poets collective since 2007, he has showcased work across Botswana, South Africa, and Zimbabwe. Based at Khama III Memorial Museum, where he manages a studio and assists with exhibitions, Baoagi also adjudicates national arts competitions. His practice, rooted in versatility, centres on enlightenment as empowerment, using art to inspire positivity and confront social challenges. Since 2022, he has worked with the Museums Association of Namibia, engaging with Namibian collections and their colonial histories. item.title: exhibitor_chlo_shain
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136905228509"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013932916957","gid://shopify/Product/9013932982493","gid://shopify/Product/9013993832669"] chloeshainart@gmail.com +27 84 437 0823 {"customer_since":"2024-04-04 18:24:43","seller_since":"2024-04-04 18:25:13","status":"1"} 962 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136905228509 gid://shopify/Product/9013932916957, gid://shopify/Product/9013932982493, gid://shopify/Product/9013993832669 Chloë Shain (b. 1993, Johannesburg) is a multidisciplinary artist and anthropologist. She holds an Honours in Fine Art from Wits University and a PhD in Anthropology from the University of Cape Town. Shain works across painting, digital collage, video animation, and installation, exploring human relationships with mobile devices through touchscreen gestures. Her recent exhibitions include Nirox Sculpture Park, NewWork22 at Wits Art Museum, and the Turbine Art Fair, where she was selected for the 2023 Unearthed mentorship programme. item.title: exhibitor_chuma_adam
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136905457885"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9014007464157"] cadam001@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2024-04-04 18:36:58","seller_since":"2024-04-04 18:39:51","status":"1"} 963 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136905457885 gid://shopify/Product/9014007464157 Chuma Adam (b. 2001) is a Johannesburg-based multidisciplinary artist working across painting, printmaking, textiles, sculpture, and drawing. Influenced by Édouard Glissant’s Poetics of Relation, her practice engages themes of visibility, Blackness, and self-actualization through abstraction, texture, and mark-making. Mixing earth from her mother’s home into her work, Adam creates immersive pieces that explore the intersections of Blackness, womanhood, and African artistic lineage. She holds an Honours degree in Fine Arts from Wits University (2024) and was shortlisted for the WITS Young Artist Award in 2022 and 2023. Johannesburg, South Africa. gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640628474077 Chuma Adam Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_kutti_collective
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136926101725"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013930787037"] kutticollective@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2024-04-04 19:25:50","seller_since":"2024-04-04 19:26:15","status":"1"} 964 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136926101725 gid://shopify/Product/9013930787037 Kutti Collective is a group of six young South African artists of South Asian ancestry who challenge social norms while redefining identity and representation. Reclaiming the word Kutti—which can mean both “bitch” and “darling” across South Asian languages—they subvert its patriarchal weight to assert power and agency. Their work reflects on ancestry, lived experiences, and traumas, complicating ideas of what it means to be South Asian and ‘Indian’ today. Durban, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640724254941 Kutti Collective Gallery

item.title: exhibitor_marielorraine_kalassa
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136933114077"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013927051485","gid://shopify/Product/9013927117021","gid://shopify/Product/9013927149789"] lkalassa@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2024-04-04 20:17:24","seller_since":"2024-04-04 20:17:55","status":"1"} 965 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136933114077 gid://shopify/Product/9013927051485, gid://shopify/Product/9013927117021, gid://shopify/Product/9013927149789 Marie-Lorraine Kalassa is a South African artist of Congolese descent whose work explores identity, ancestry, and notions of home. Using personal archives, reflexive writing, and diverse media, she investigates how memory, place, and culture shape selfhood and belonging. Kalassa holds a Fine Arts degree from Michaelis School of Fine Arts and an Honours in Landscape Architecture from the University of Cape Town. She is a member of The Photographic Collective (TPC) and has exhibited in shows including JIVE Exhibition (2023), We Are Culture (2022), and 1-54 Contemporary African Art Fair (London, 2021). gid://shopify/Product/9013933080797 Tamary Kudita is a multi-award-winning Zimbabwean fine art photographer, scholar, and visual artist exploring African identity, cultural duality, and transgenerational memory. A Michaelis School of Fine Art graduate (BFA, 2017), she gained international recognition as the first African to win the 2021 Open Photographer of the Year at the Sony World Photography Awards for her series African Victorian. Kudita’s work has been exhibited globally, including Art Basel Miami, Sharjah Xposure, Investec Cape Town Art Fair, and Photo Vogue Festival Milan. Her accolades include the J.M.D Manyika Fellowship (Harvard, 2023), See Me Art Takes Runner Up (2021), and honorable mentions from the International Photography Awards. Her art is held in prestigious collections, including the Fitchburg Art Museum (USA) and The Betsy Gallery (Florida), and has been featured in international media such as BBC, CNN, Forbes, and Vogue Italia. Harare, Zimbabwe gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640765640925 Tamary Kudita Independent Artist

gid://shopify/Product/9013928722653 Salon Kewpie: The Legacy Project is an interdisciplinary platform providing queer and disadvantaged youth with creative access to the themes embodied in the Kewpie Collection. The initiative bridges contemporary ballroom culture with a rich historical photographic archive, centred on the life of Kewpie Fritz (1941–2012) — a celebrated hairdresser, performer, and fearless queer icon of apartheid-era District Six. Through workshops led by experts in activism, mental health, ballroom culture, and drag artistry, the programme nurtures personal and artistic growth while reclaiming histories of resilience, freedom, and belonging. The culmination of this journey is the Salon Kewpie: The Legacy Ball — a vibrant celebration uniting youth, queer and trans elders, and the District Six community in honour of Kewpie’s enduring spirit. Bringing Kewpie’s legacy home to District Six. Cape Town, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640749846749 Salon Kewpie Non-profit Organizations

Working with diverse media—from paint and animation to food packaging and cake—she explores themes of land, power, consumption, and culpability with wit and sharp critique. Recurring motifs like chef toques, rats, and phosphorescent objects trace connections between agriculture, warfare, and globalised food systems, questioning the ethics of consumption and the invisibility of labour in industrial production. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640592527581 Andrea Burgener Independent Artist

Gallery is a visual arts project, mentorship program, mobile studio, and artist residency founded in July 2023 by Mary Sibande and Lawrence Lemaoana. It collaborates with emerging artists—called “Occupants”—to produce experimental and immersive exhibitions, transforming gallery spaces into interactive experiences. The initiative spans diverse media, fostering dialogue around identity, space, and culture while bridging access to industry, professional growth, and opportunities for young artists. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640743194845 Occupying The Gallery Gallery

gid://shopify/Product/9014106915037, gid://shopify/Product/9014107013341 Since 2013, Candice Berman Gallery has been a premier destination in Johannesburg for fine art collectors. Guided by a deep curiosity for the cultural and personal narratives behind art, the gallery represents a diverse collection of media with a primary focus on the Expressionist Movement. The gallery is founded on a commitment to supporting the development of its artists, creating novel opportunities for their work to be shared both locally and internationally. We consider it our privilege to connect collectors with exceptional raw talent and unique, compelling pieces. Beyond its exhibition program, Candice Berman Gallery offers a complete suite of services. Our expert consultants collaborate with clients to build unique collections, while our highly trained team provides professional installation. We also offer custom, museum-quality framing as a certified Guild-Commended Framer, ensuring the highest standard of care for your artworks. We invite you to visit our regularly hosted exhibitions to discover the artists shaping the contemporary art landscape. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640614547677 Candice Berman Gallery Gallery

item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136940290269"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013941502173","gid://shopify/Product/9013941436637","gid://shopify/Product/9013941371101","gid://shopify/Product/9013941272797","gid://shopify/Product/9013941207261","gid://shopify/Product/9013941174493","gid://shopify/Product/9013941141725","gid://shopify/Product/9013941076189","gid://shopify/Product/9013941043421","gid://shopify/Product/9013941010653","gid://shopify/Product/9013940977885","gid://shopify/Product/9013940912349","gid://shopify/Product/9013316813021"] info@nelsonmakamo.africa.com 0000000000 {"customer_since":"2024-05-02 13:42:52","seller_since":"2024-05-02 13:45:11","status":"1"} ["gid:\/\/shopify\/Metaobject\/136940290269"] ["gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013941502173","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013941436637","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013941371101","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013941272797","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013941207261","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013941174493","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013941141725","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013941076189","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013941043421","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013941010653","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013940977885","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013940912349","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9013316813021"] Nelson Makamo is a Johannesburg-based artist from Limpopo, South Africa, celebrated for his compelling portraits of African children that capture resilience, beauty, and emotion. Working across charcoal, acrylic, print, and watercolor, his storytelling emphasizes spontaneity and expressive mark-making. Trained at Artist Proof Studios, Makamo draws influence from Dumile Feni, Picasso, and Van Gogh. His work has been exhibited internationally—in South Africa, the USA, France, Italy, the Netherlands, England, and Scotland—and is included in prestigious collections worldwide. Makamo has also gained mainstream recognition, appearing on The Daily Show with Trevor Noah and on the cover of Time magazine, while mentoring young African artists and reshaping global perceptions of African childhood. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640740049117 Nelson Makamo Studio Gallery

Working across textile art, printmaking, photography, design, and performance, she is best known for her vibrant yarn paintings that weave stories of Black joy, fantasy, and identity. Rooted in her experiences and cultural background, Maake’s work celebrates the exuberance of youth while exploring the complexities of African heritage and belonging. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640719405277 Keabetse Maake Independent Artist

Lemkus Gallery, located in the Exchange Building on St George’s Mall, was founded in 2024 to host and support the Residency28 programme — an initiative providing emerging local artists with studio space, funding, and professional support to develop sustainable creative practices. Backed by Lemkus and PayJustNow, the residency offers five weeks of studio access, a stipend for materials and living expenses, mentorship, and culminates in a solo exhibition at the gallery. Beyond the residency, Lemkus Gallery functions as a dynamic project space, hosting group shows and experimental exhibitions to foster collaboration and community within Cape Town’s arts scene. Cape Town, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640729432285 Lemkus Gallery Gallery

gid://shopify/Product/9013982068957 Amasaka Gallery is a dynamic contemporary art space in Masaka, Uganda, established in 2020 by artist Collin Sekajugo. The gallery is dedicated to showcasing and nurturing the region's most promising emerging artistic talent. Born from Sekajugo's acclaimed Weaver Bird Residency program, Amasaka Gallery's founding mission is to provide mentorship, support, and a platform for experimentation. It fosters a creative environment where local and regional artists are encouraged to push the boundaries of their practice, from painting and photography to installation. With a satellite space in Kampala and a network of international collaborations, Amasaka is actively redefining the regional art scene and inviting the global art world to look beyond its traditional centres. Through its ambitious program of exhibitions, art fair participation, and collaborative projects, the gallery has quickly established itself as a vital contributor to both local and international art communities. Kampala, Uganda gid://shopify/MediaImage/36725620834525 Amasaka Gallery Gallery

A multidisciplinary practitioner, she works in painting, photography, sculpture, and interactive sound. Isabella has exhibited at the 1-54 Contemporary African Art Fair (London) and in Polokwane, South Africa. In 2023, she received a Chevening Scholarship and is pursuing a master’s in Fine Art at Oxford. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640705675485 Isabella Maake Independent Artist

Inspired by the strong women in her family, she celebrates unity, resilience, and grace through her art, using diverse mediums to reflect her personal experiences and evolving imagination. Her practice seeks to educate, heal, and inspire, highlighting the strength and beauty of women in contemporary society. gid://shopify/Product/9013994750173, gid://shopify/Product/9013994782941 Lee-Ann Olwage is a South African visual storyteller whose collaborative photography explores themes of gender and identity. With a background in film directing and set design, she creates affirming, narrative-driven imagery that celebrates her subjects’ agency. Her acclaimed project The Right To Play highlights the barriers girls face in accessing education while imagining empowering, playful futures where they thrive. Olwage’s work has appeared in National Geographic, Vogue, The Guardian, and Foam Magazine. She is a multi-award-winning artist, with honours including the World Press Photo Award (2020, 2023, 2024) and the Sony World Photography Award (2023). Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640726909149 Lee-Ann Olwage Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_marie_aime_fattouche
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136933048541"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013977383133","gid://shopify/Product/9013977579741","gid://shopify/Product/9013979283677","gid://shopify/Product/9013979349213","gid://shopify/Product/9013979447517"] marieaimee.fattouche@gmail.com 33667381966 {"customer_since":"2024-07-17 03:46:27","seller_since":"2024-07-17 03:47:08","status":"1"} 1036 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136933048541 gid://shopify/Product/9013977383133, gid://shopify/Product/9013977579741, gid://shopify/Product/9013979283677, gid://shopify/Product/9013979349213, gid://shopify/Product/9013979447517 Marie Aimée Fattouche (b. 1991, lives and works in Seine-Saint-Denis, France) is a multidisciplinary artist whose work explores the mechanics of mind, body, and environment. Drawing from her Egyptian heritage, she examines power structures, femininity, and collective belief systems through fluid, ever-evolving compositions that blur the boundaries between rupture and repair. A graduate of Chelsea College of Arts, London (MA Fine Art, 2016), Fattouche has received several accolades, including the Mercers’ Arts Award and the Red Mansion Art Prize. Her work has been exhibited internationally at venues such as the Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art (MAMC+), Standpoint Gallery, and Galerie du Haut-Pavé, where she presented her solo show NOUS INFINIR MON AMOUR in 2024. Paris, France gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640734707933 Marie Aimée Fattouche Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_southern_guild
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136964014301"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9014104981725","gid://shopify/Product/9014105145565","gid://shopify/Product/9014105309405","gid://shopify/Product/9014105342173","gid://shopify/Product/9014105473245"] gallery@southernguild.com {"customer_since":"2024-07-20 18:53:16","seller_since":"2024-07-20 18:54:57","status":"1"} gid://shopify/Metaobject/136964014301 gid://shopify/Product/9014104981725, gid://shopify/Product/9014105145565, gid://shopify/Product/9014105309405, gid://shopify/Product/9014105342173, gid://shopify/Product/9014105473245 Southern Guild, founded in 2008 by Trevyn and Julian McGowan, represents contemporary African artists from the continent and diaspora, with locations in Cape Town and Los Angeles. The gallery supports artists exploring culture, spirituality, identity, ancestral knowledge, and ecology through collaborative projects, exhibitions, and its GUILD Residency programme. Southern Guild fosters emerging talent via education, mentorship, and interdisciplinary initiatives, while participating in international fairs and biennales. Its artists’ works are held in major collections, including the Metropolitan Museum of Art, LACMA, Art Institute of Chicago, Pérez Art Museum, and Vitra Museum, and have exhibited at institutions such as Centre Pompidou, Brooklyn Museum, Seoul Museum of Art, and Cooper Hewitt Smithsonian Design Museum. Cape Town, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640763019485 Southern Guild Gallery

Drawing on dreams, journaling, and freestyle painting, her practice is autobiographical and cathartic, blending painting, digital collage, and poetry. Fell began creating art in her mother’s ceramic studio in KwaZulu-Natal and later studied creative writing, media, philosophy, and literature. She has exhibited at the KZNSA, ANON. Pop Up, and Zeitz MOCAA, and currently works from her studio in Kommetjie, Cape Town. Cape Town, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640755450077 Sarah Jayne Fell Independent Artist

Her work explores ancestral connection, intersectional feminism, and the meaning of Indigeneity. Drawing inspiration from the ocean and Amazigh symbolism, she creates paintings that reflect harmony, heritage, and collective responsibility. Currently an art fellow at laba Berlin and Künstlerhaus Bethanien, she uses art to foster cross-cultural dialogue and shared values. and natural pigments to explore human-nature relationships. She holds an MFA from Michaelis School of Fine Art, UCT, and draws inspiration from landscapes across Southern Africa and Botswana. Her work, including landscape paintings and organic installations, has been exhibited locally and internationally, with solo shows such as Raaswater (2019) and Spoorloos (2021), and group exhibitions including Earth Power! (2022, Brussels) and 1-54 London. Conradie’s practice encourages reflection on humanity’s connection to nature. item.title: exhibitor_blessing_blaai
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136901525725"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9014037446877","gid://shopify/Product/9014040002781"] blessinblaai@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2024-11-11 11:28:29","seller_since":"2024-11-11 11:28:55","status":"1"} 1101 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136901525725 gid://shopify/Product/9014037446877, gid://shopify/Product/9014040002781 Blessing N Blaai (b. 1994, Johannesburg) is an artist whose practice spans painting, drawing, printmaking, and mural art. Rooted in the suburban landscape of Troyeville, his work reflects a deep engagement with community and urban space. A graduate of Artist Proof Studio, where he specialised in printmaking, Blaai has developed a versatile practice that includes watercolour, ink, and mixed media. As a muralist, he has contributed to public and private commissions, including city-commissioned projects that transform urban environments. His work has been featured in group exhibitions such as African Mobilities: This Is Not a Refugee Camp. Dedicated to art as a tool for connection, Blaai has also facilitated community arts programs with the Market Foundation at Windybrow Theatre, creating creative outlets for children in Hillbrow and beyond. Johannesburg. South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640605634781 Blessing Blaai Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_lerato_motaung
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136927903965"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9014042329309","gid://shopify/Product/9014042394845","gid://shopify/Product/9014042427613","gid://shopify/Product/9014042460381"] lrato431@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2024-12-04 08:53:09","seller_since":"2024-12-04 08:53:46","status":"1"} 1114 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136927903965 gid://shopify/Product/9014042329309, gid://shopify/Product/9014042394845, gid://shopify/Product/9014042427613, gid://shopify/Product/9014042460381 Lerato Motaung (b. 1991, Germiston) is a Johannesburg-based multidisciplinary artist whose practice explores memory, identity, and collective narratives. Through expressive color and layered compositions, Motaung reflects on the emotional weight of remembrance, transformation, and resilience. He holds a National Diploma in Fine Art from Tshwane University of Technology and was a finalist in the 2021 Sasol New Signatures Awards. His international recognition includes the Our Africa, Our Future residency in Senegal (2022) and exhibitions at Christie's Paris, Haart Gallery London, THK Gallery Cologne, and the Pretoria Art Museum. Motaung’s work forms part of major collections including Foundation H (Paris and Madagascar) and Africa First. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640729825501 Lerato Motaung Independent Artist

Working in the tradition of social critique, her art confronts uncomfortable truths through realistic rendering, rich symbolism, and ornamental detail. Kellow holds a BA Honours in Fine Arts (with distinction) from Wits University and was a 2024 finalist for the prestigious Rust-en-Vrede Portrait Award. Her work invites viewers to uncover complex narratives that balance confrontation with moments of dark humour and consolation. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36725585379549 Ada-Ruth Kellow Independent Artist

A former high school English and History teacher, Sam draws on his fascination with narrative, humor, and everyday absurdities. His work has been featured in group exhibitions at The Gallery (Johannesburg), Turbine Art Fair (2022), and Latitudes Art Fair (2023). item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136925970653"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9014051373277","gid://shopify/Product/9133213515997","gid://shopify/Product/9133224329437","gid://shopify/Product/9133224460509","gid://shopify/Product/9133224788189","gid://shopify/Product/9133231243485","gid://shopify/Product/9133231571165","gid://shopify/Product/9133234258141"] itskulnzu@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2025-03-04 07:58:07","seller_since":"2025-03-04 07:59:10","status":"1"} gid://shopify/Metaobject/136925970653 gid://shopify/Product/9014051373277, gid://shopify/Product/9133213515997, gid://shopify/Product/9133224329437, gid://shopify/Product/9133224460509, gid://shopify/Product/9133224788189, gid://shopify/Product/9133231243485, gid://shopify/Product/9133231571165, gid://shopify/Product/9133234258141 kulnZu (b. 1998) is a Mozambican artist and scholar based in Nairobi, Kenya. Working across photography, collage, and writing, their practice explores queerness and tender representations of queer intimacy and masculinities. They hold a B.A. in Africana Studies from Pomona College and are pursuing an MSc in African Studies at the University of Oxford. Their research and art engage with queer urban cultural production, mobility, and the imagining of ‘afroqueer futurity’—envisioning queer lives, bodies, and belonging through creative practice. Through a dynamic program of art residencies, community dialogues, and art education initiatives, we serve as a vital platform for cultural exchange and innovation. The collective champions Botswana’s creative development and archives its artistic practices, addressing under-representation locally and internationally. Drawing inspiration from national pavilions at global events, TBP bridges fine art, visual art, and traditional crafts. Its projects include exhibitions like No Return (Gallery MOMO, 2019), Subjective Nationhood (Botswana National Art Gallery, 2019), the virtual Collective Ties (2020), and Maš(w)i a Ditoro (tsa Rona) (Frankfurt, 2022). TBP also produced the video Kgolokwe: Separated Intersections, screened internationally in Basel, New York, Cape Town, São Paulo, and Berlin. Gaborone, Botswana gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640766165213 TBP Artist Collective Gallery

Established in 2019, it serves as a platform for local and international artists, fostering collaboration and cultural exchange. Beyond exhibitions, it offers a makers-space for sculptors and designers, as well as immersive art retreats that blend creativity with the natural beauty of the Okavango Delta. A true sanctuary for artists and art enthusiasts alike, The Space Botswana is redefining the creative landscape of Southern Africa. ["gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014088728797","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014088663261","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014088630493","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014088532189","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014084501725","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014084468957","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014084436189","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014051537117","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014083879133","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014083846365","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014083813597","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014083780829","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014083748061","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014110126301","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014110093533","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014083715293","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014083682525","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014084108509","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014084075741","gid:\/\/shopify\/Product\/9014084042973"] The Art Residency Centre (ARC) is an artist-led initiative in Gaborone, Botswana, dedicated to providing space, support, and new platforms for contemporary creatives. At its core, ARC offers a residency program that provides selected artists with time, space, mentorship, and resources for a period of one to three months. The program is designed to actively contribute to the development of the artist's creative practice. Located at the Gaborone Sports & Social Club, ARC's studio and reference library, 'The ARChive,' serves as a hub for both the resident artist and the wider community. It is open to the public on Saturdays, offering opportunities for dialogue and feedback. Beyond the residency, ARC fosters a vibrant cultural ecosystem through regular film screenings, reading groups, zine workshops, exhibitions, and talks. Through a strong network of local collaborators, ARC provides invaluable networking opportunities and diverse platforms for creatives to develop, dialogue, and display their work. Gaborone, Botswana gid://shopify/MediaImage/36725633286365 Art Residency Centre Gallery

item.title: exhibitor_desire_marea
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136908538077"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9014048522461","gid://shopify/Product/9014048555229","gid://shopify/Product/9014048587997","gid://shopify/Product/9014048620765","gid://shopify/Product/9014048686301"] izimakade@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2025-03-24 13:31:39","seller_since":"2025-03-24 13:43:18","status":"1"} 1166 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136908538077 gid://shopify/Product/9014048522461, gid://shopify/Product/9014048555229, gid://shopify/Product/9014048587997, gid://shopify/Product/9014048620765, gid://shopify/Product/9014048686301 Desire Marea (Duma Buyani) (b. 1991, Scottburgh, KwaZulu-Natal) is a South African artist based in Amandawe. Orphaned at six, they were raised by a supportive extended family and later discovered their lineage to Menzi Mcunu, a celebrated Durban artist and community activist. Marea studied at the National School of the Arts and earned a BA in Visual Communication from Vega School. Deeply inspired by Black culture, history, and family, their work draws on influences from artists such as Zanele Muholi, Athi-Patra Ruga, Sabelo Mlangeni, and Luvuyo Nyawose. KwaZulu-Nata, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640650002653 DESIRE MAREA Independent Artist

gid://shopify/MediaImage/36783937749213 Asisebenze Art Atelier (AAA) is a dynamic artistic hub in the heart of Johannesburg, uniquely combining an artist residency, studio spaces, and a dealership within a single ecosystem. Located in the historic Blue Plaque Heritage Building at 28 Plein Street, AAA is dedicated to nurturing and showcasing both emerging and established African creative talent. Spanning six floors, the atelier provides artists with housing, studio space, and professional mentorship, empowering them to build sustainable careers while pursuing creative freedom. The art created within Asisebenze is a direct reflection of Johannesburg's vibrant inner-city energy, with each piece telling a story of contemporary African life, culture, and identity. As a key player in the local art scene, AAA offers a direct gateway to the soul of Johannesburg's contemporary art, fostering a space where talent flourishes and careers are built Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36725635842269 Asisebenze Art Atelier Gallery

Its mission is to help artists sustain their careers by offering workshops in business and artistic growth, while fostering international networking and collaboration. The foundation also runs the Blessing Ngobeni Art Prize, which supports outstanding artists under 35 working in painting, sculpture, mixed media, or performance. Recipients receive studio space, a materials budget, a stipend, mentorship, and a funded solo exhibition. BNAP Foundation is proudly sponsored by Art Angels, the Johannesburg Stock Exchange (JSE), and Everard Read Gallery Cape Town. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640606585053 BNAP Foundation Non-profit Organizations

item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136903655645"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9014059368669","gid://shopify/Product/9014059434205","gid://shopify/Product/9014059466973","gid://shopify/Product/9014059991261","gid://shopify/Product/9014060024029","gid://shopify/Product/9014060122333","gid://shopify/Product/9014060220637","gid://shopify/Product/9014060548317"] candy@mwebbiz.co.za {"customer_since":"2025-03-26 14:59:48","seller_since":"2025-03-26 15:02:13","status":"1"} 1173 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136903655645 gid://shopify/Product/9014059368669, gid://shopify/Product/9014059434205, gid://shopify/Product/9014059466973, gid://shopify/Product/9014059991261, gid://shopify/Product/9014060024029, gid://shopify/Product/9014060122333, gid://shopify/Product/9014060220637, gid://shopify/Product/9014060548317 Candice Michelle Kramer (b. 1974, Johannesburg) is a South African painter exploring the transience of life against Johannesburg’s enduring cityscape. Working with metal surfaces, rust, and corrosion, her work references people, family photos, and maps to examine memory, time, and urban belonging. Kramer holds a BA in Fine Arts from Wits University and has exhibited at Obert Contemporary, NIROX Projects, Kalashnikovv Gallery, and 1:54 London Art Fair. Her work is in collections including Spier, Nandos, RMB, and FirstRand, and she is a resident artist at The Bag Factory, Johannesburg. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640614809821 Candice Kramer Independent Artist

gid://shopify/Product/9014111699165, gid://shopify/Product/9014111731933, gid://shopify/Product/9014111764701 Based in Lagos, Nigeria, AMG Projects is a contemporary art gallery on a mission to empower emerging African artists and curators. The gallery serves as a critical gateway for discovering game-changing talent, providing a vital platform to facilitate broader social access and global opportunities. AMG Projects curates and supports ambitious projects across diverse media, from painting and mixed-media to conceptual installations. The gallery's program is geared towards promoting curiosity and encouraging critical dialogue, with a particular focus on post-colonial and socio-political contexts in Africa. Through its dynamic exhibitions and participation in major art fairs, AMG Projects actively works to connect the continent's artists with the international art world. Lagos, Nigeria gid://shopify/MediaImage/36725622800605 AMG Projects Gallery

gid://shopify/Product/9014088302813 Kevin Collins studied painting at the Michaelis School of Fine Art, UCT, under Stanley Pinker, Helmut Starke, and Cecil Skotnes. After two decades in brand communications, a health setback led him back to art, culminating in his 2003 solo exhibition The Taxonomy of Non-Endangered Species at Gallery Moja. Now working primarily in ceramics, Collins draws inspiration from travel, childhood imagery, and everyday ephemera. His works are held in collections across South Africa and internationally. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640720748765 Kevin Collins Independent Artist

global art ecosystem. Co-founded by Gallerists Atang L.S. Arnold and Frehiwot Demissie, The Spaces Africa is a network that empowers emerging galleries, artists and art spaces by providing visibility, resources, and collaborative opportunities to help them thrive in an increasingly competitive art market. By connecting young African Galleries to the world, we aim to transform our passions into sustainable success by bridging the gaps and establishing pathways for African Contemporary Art. item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136927379677","gid://shopify/Metaobject/136894120157","gid://shopify/Metaobject/136933998813","gid://shopify/Metaobject/136916435165","gid://shopify/Metaobject/136940585181","gid://shopify/Metaobject/136963293405"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013351678173","gid://shopify/Product/9014066053341","gid://shopify/Product/9014067757277","gid://shopify/Product/9014067822813","gid://shopify/Product/9014067855581","gid://shopify/Product/9014067921117","gid://shopify/Product/9014068019421","gid://shopify/Product/9014068052189","gid://shopify/Product/9014068117725","gid://shopify/Product/9014068150493","gid://shopify/Product/9014068183261","gid://shopify/Product/9014068216029","gid://shopify/Product/9014068248797","gid://shopify/Product/9014068281565","gid://shopify/Product/9014068379869"] firstlight.admin@hopefortheblind.org {"customer_since":"2025-04-24 12:47:26","seller_since":"2025-04-24 12:48:44","status":"1"} 1188 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136927379677, gid://shopify/Metaobject/136894120157, gid://shopify/Metaobject/136933998813, gid://shopify/Metaobject/136916435165, gid://shopify/Metaobject/136940585181, gid://shopify/Metaobject/136963293405 gid://shopify/Product/9013351678173, gid://shopify/Product/9014066053341, gid://shopify/Product/9014067757277, gid://shopify/Product/9014067822813, gid://shopify/Product/9014067855581, gid://shopify/Product/9014067921117, gid://shopify/Product/9014068019421, gid://shopify/Product/9014068052189, gid://shopify/Product/9014068117725, gid://shopify/Product/9014068150493, gid://shopify/Product/9014068183261, gid://shopify/Product/9014068216029, gid://shopify/Product/9014068248797, gid://shopify/Product/9014068281565, gid://shopify/Product/9014068379869 The First Light Project is an innovative art initiative based in Modimolle, Limpopo, where art, nature, and ophthalmology converge. Hosted within the Hope for the Blind (HFTB) eye hospital, the project integrates an exhibition space into the clinic’s design—offering post-operative patients their first visual encounter with art after cataract surgery. Curated by Johan Stegmann and Lawrence Lemaoana, the project reimagines art’s role in healing by transforming restored sight into a deeply emotional and aesthetic experience. Beyond showcasing contemporary works, it reflects on vision, perception, and renewal. Proceeds from the First Light Project, including a portion of each artwork sold, directly support subsidised eye surgeries for disadvantaged patients—merging creativity with compassion to restore both sight and hope. Modimolle, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640668811485 First Light Project Non-profit Organizations

established reputation for identifying, attracting, nurturing, rewarding and celebrating exceptional talent. Liberating diverse talent to do good business for a better world is in our DNA, and we believe that ‘unlocking talent’ is key to our ongoing success. This core, ‘talent-centric’ commitment extends through all our brand partnerships, like our broad investment across the creative economy. Through RMB Talent Unlocked and in partnership with the FirstRand Foundation, we are proud to be part of the vital role that the visual arts play in our society, as both a catalyst for conversation and an archive of time. item.title: exhibitor_azola_kingston
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136899920093"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9133216104669"] azolakingston.art@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2025-07-16 09:00:09","seller_since":"2025-07-16 09:01:02","status":"1"} 1232 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136899920093 gid://shopify/Product/9133216104669 Azola Kingston (b. 1994, Philadelphia; raised in Johannesburg) is a self-taught visual artist whose work is a bold celebration of Blackness. Through vibrant colour and layered composition, she affirms African stories, traditions, and voices as central to the cultural conversation. Her paintings draw beauty from community, shared rituals, and generational wisdom, creating vivid, powerful narratives of pride, presence, and resilience. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640598655197 Azola Kingston Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_amy_rusch
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136897102045"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9132522602717","gid://shopify/Product/9133224001757","gid://shopify/Product/9133224067293","gid://shopify/Product/9133224100061","gid://shopify/Product/9133224198365","gid://shopify/Product/9133233045725"] amy.rusch@gmail.com 27741237165 {"customer_since":"2025-07-16 09:14:40","seller_since":"2025-07-16 09:15:05","status":"1"} 1233 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136897102045 gid://shopify/Product/9132522602717, gid://shopify/Product/9133224001757, gid://shopify/Product/9133224067293, gid://shopify/Product/9133224100061, gid://shopify/Product/9133224198365, gid://shopify/Product/9133233045725 Amy Rusch is a multidisciplinary artist whose practice explores vibrational mark-making through stitched thread in found plastic. Her process—cutting, stitching, heating, layering—transforms discarded materials into reflections on human and elemental time. She has exhibited widely, with recent presentations at Investec Cape Town Art Fair (2025), FNB Art Joburg (2024), and a solo with SMAC Gallery (2022). Her work has also featured at the Norval Foundation, Pretoria Art Museum, Iziko South African National Gallery, and Zeitz MOCAA. Cape Town, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640582303965 Amy Rusch Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_chigozie_obi
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136905064669"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9133216465117","gid://shopify/Product/9133234847965"] chigozieobi.p@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2025-07-16 11:51:55","seller_since":"2025-07-16 11:52:52","status":"1"} 1234 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136905064669 gid://shopify/Product/9133216465117, gid://shopify/Product/9133234847965 Chigozie Obi (b. 1997) is a Nigerian multidisciplinary artist whose practice reflects on human complexity, beauty, culture, women’s narratives, mental health, and healing. Her work draws from personal and collective experiences to foster connection and dialogue. She earned a Visual Arts degree from the University of Lagos in 2017 and has exhibited internationally, including 1-54 Marrakech (2025), Yenwa Gallery, Lagos (2024), AG18 Gallery, Vienna (2024), and Future Fair, New York (2023). Obi won the Access Bank Art X Prize (2021), The Future Awards Prize for Art (2021), and held a residency at Gasworks, London (2022). Lagos, Nigeria gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640619299037 Chigozie Obi Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_fetlework_tadesse
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136912404701"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9132522504413","gid://shopify/Product/9132522635485","gid://shopify/Product/9133213122781","gid://shopify/Product/9133215711453","gid://shopify/Product/9133230588125","gid://shopify/Product/9133231669469"] janfelajano@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2025-07-16 12:05:27","seller_since":"2025-07-16 12:06:03","status":"1"} 1235 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136912404701 gid://shopify/Product/9132522504413, gid://shopify/Product/9132522635485, gid://shopify/Product/9133213122781, gid://shopify/Product/9133215711453, gid://shopify/Product/9133230588125, gid://shopify/Product/9133231669469 Fetlework Tadesse (Fela), born in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, is a painter and sculptor. She holds a diploma in Fine Arts (sculpture) from Entoto Technical College (2004) and a BA in Painting from Addis Ababa University (2019). Fela has participated in numerous group exhibitions at venues including the Ethiopian National Theatre, Ethiopian National Museum, Red Door Art Gallery, and Addis Fine Art. Her debut solo exhibition was held at Findika Cultural Center in 2023, and she has exhibited internationally, including at the Addis Ababa Modern Art Museum and the Investec Cape Town Art Fair (2024). Her semi-realistic work often features self-portraits reflecting daily life, emotions, and attitudes, inspired by body gestures, fashion, and everyday patterns. Fela explores anatomy, structure, and color to convey personal narratives. She is part of the “Roots and Wings” group exhibition in Stuttgart, Germany (July 2025). Addis Ababa, Ethiopia gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640667697373 Fetlework Tadesse Independent Artist

item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136905097437"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9132522471645","gid://shopify/Product/9133215613149","gid://shopify/Product/9133224231133","gid://shopify/Product/9133232259293","gid://shopify/Product/9133233176797"] peaceneche94@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2025-07-16 12:22:00","seller_since":"2025-07-16 12:22:23","status":"1"} 1236 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136905097437 gid://shopify/Product/9132522471645, gid://shopify/Product/9133215613149, gid://shopify/Product/9133224231133, gid://shopify/Product/9133232259293, gid://shopify/Product/9133233176797 Chinecherem is a Nigerian textile artist whose practice reflects personal emotions and women’s lived realities while bridging tradition and innovation. She graduated as Best Student in Industrial Design (Textile) from IMT Enugu in 2017. Her work has featured in exhibitions such as the 2025 Kuenyehia Prize for Contemporary Art Exhibition, +234 Art Fair, Rele Arts Foundation’s Young Contemporaries (2025), and the 2021 My View From the Other Side exhibition at the Embassy of Spain, Abuja. She won the 2024 Kuenyehia Prize for Contemporary Art, and is a 2024 Fellow of both the Rele Arts Foundation and Kuta Art Residency. Anambra state, Nigeria gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640621756637 Chinecherem Peace Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_aleruchi_kinika
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136895594717"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9133230555357","gid://shopify/Product/9133233144029","gid://shopify/Product/9133234225373","gid://shopify/Product/9133234323677"] alexiekhin@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2025-07-16 12:29:35","seller_since":"2025-07-16 12:29:58","status":"1"} 1237 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136895594717 gid://shopify/Product/9133230555357, gid://shopify/Product/9133233144029, gid://shopify/Product/9133234225373, gid://shopify/Product/9133234323677 Aleruchi Kinika (b.1997) is a Port Harcourt–based visual artist working in photography, writing, and drawing. Her practice preserves culture and identity through surreal, chiaroscuro-inspired storytelling that explores femininity, beauty, and fashion. Influenced by cinema and baroque light-play, Kinika conveys emotion and cultural values with dramatic intensity. She has exhibited internationally, including Polaroid x Magnum at Paris Photo Fair, and participated in residencies such as Divergence, 1952 (Lagos) and Alternative Heritage (Ibadan). Port Harcourt, Nigeria gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640574505181 Aleruchi Kinika Independent Artist

She is the founder of The Muse Multi Studios (2019) and The Sudan Art Archive (2022), supporting and preserving Sudanese visual arts. Her work in painting, installation, and printmaking explores movement, space, memory, and self-image. Aljeally has exhibited internationally and currently leads the Artists Development Program at Ubuntu Art Gallery in Cairo. New Cairo, Egypt gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640747684061 Reem Aljeally Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_haneem_christian
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136916041949"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9133230194909","gid://shopify/Product/9133233897693","gid://shopify/Product/9134148518109"] haneemchristian@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2025-07-17 05:49:15","seller_since":"2025-07-17 05:49:38","status":"1"} 1240 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136916041949 gid://shopify/Product/9133230194909, gid://shopify/Product/9133233897693, gid://shopify/Product/9134148518109 Haneem Christian is a Cape Town-based archivist and filmmaker whose lens-based practice explores Pan-African history through Queerness, centering community and African narratives. Their work has been shown at the International Cape Town Art Fair, 1-54 New York, AKAA, Latitudes, Unseen Photo Fair, and the National Portrait Gallery, London. Christian won the Pride Photo Award 2022, the Taylor Wessing National Portrait Award 2022, and a British Council Artist Grant, which funded their first docu-art film, Eyes to See, premiering at BFI Flare 2025. They have also completed a Magnum Photos residency, participated in a Nike campaign, and exhibited at the Cape Town International Art Fair. Cape Town, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640683327709 Haneem Christian Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_doaa_fakher
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136909226205"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9133212205277","gid://shopify/Product/9133213647069","gid://shopify/Product/9133215744221","gid://shopify/Product/9133224263901","gid://shopify/Product/9133231505629","gid://shopify/Product/9133233340637","gid://shopify/Product/9133234880733"] doaafakher7@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2025-07-17 06:00:16","seller_since":"2025-07-17 06:00:42","status":"1"} 1241 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136909226205 gid://shopify/Product/9133212205277, gid://shopify/Product/9133213647069, gid://shopify/Product/9133215744221, gid://shopify/Product/9133224263901, gid://shopify/Product/9133231505629, gid://shopify/Product/9133233340637, gid://shopify/Product/9133234880733 Doaa Fakher (b.1992, Cairo) is an Egyptian artist whose work explores human and societal issues through distorted, anonymous figures that reflect emotional and psychological states shaped by social injustice. Working in acrylic, oil, silkscreen, and sculpture, she uses the human body as a symbol of vulnerability and resilience. Fakher holds a BA in Art Education (Cairo University, 2012) and an MA in African Arts (Helwan University, 2020). Her work has been exhibited nationally and internationally, including AKAA Paris, 1-54 Contemporary African Art Fair, and the Luxor International Painting Symposium, and is in the Museum of Modern Egyptian Art collection. She is represented by Ubuntu Art Gallery, Cairo. Cairo, Egypt gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640651018461 Doaa Fakher Independent Artist

item.title: exhibitor_dina_nomena
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136908964061"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9133230227677","gid://shopify/Product/9133233078493","gid://shopify/Product/9133233111261"] dinaandriarimanjaka@gmail.com {"customer_since":"2025-07-17 06:07:23","seller_since":"2025-07-17 06:07:50","status":"1"} 1242 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136908964061 gid://shopify/Product/9133230227677, gid://shopify/Product/9133233078493, gid://shopify/Product/9133233111261 Dina Nomena Andriarimanjaka is a Malagasy visual artist, designer, and researcher whose transdisciplinary practice blends memory, textile, and resistance. Using embroidery, fabric remnants, and archival fragments, she explores women’s untold stories through a slow, layered process. Inspired by Malagasy heritage, matrimony, and cultural rituals, her work creates dialogue between past and present, and between individual and collective memory. Antananarivo, Madagascar gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640650625245 Dina Nomena Independent Artist

gid://shopify/Product/9133221347549, gid://shopify/Product/9133221609693 Brett Rubin (b.1982, Johannesburg) is a South African photographer and visual artist. He holds a graduate degree in Film, Media & Visual Studies from the University of Cape Town (2005). Rubin has worked across fashion, design, and portraiture, notably serving as the official photographer for jazz legend Hugh Masekela from 2012 until Masekela’s passing in 2018. His work explores portraiture, landscape, and the post-colonial figure, challenging conventional photographic methods. Rubin’s work has been exhibited locally and internationally, including at Design Indaba, Edinburgh International Art and Fashion Festival, Nirox Winter Sculpture Exhibition, and Southbank Centre, London. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640610255069 Brett Rubin Independent Artist

gid://shopify/Product/9014103212253 Founded in 1913, Everard Read is Africa's oldest and largest commercial art gallery. For over a century, it has been a premier institution in the South African art world, dedicated to showcasing the country's finest contemporary artists. With seven distinct galleries across four key locations—Johannesburg, Cape Town, London, and Franschhoek—Everard Read offers an international platform for artists from diverse backgrounds. The gallery's mission is to support artists who are committed to contemporary storytelling, exceptional craft, and the making of meaning. It champions work that interrogates both universal and Afrocentric ideas, creating contemporary icons that inspire contemplation, introspection, and awe. Everard Read is committed to the long-term representation of exceptional, established voices while continuously seeking out and nurturing the next generation of talent, ensuring a dynamic and relevant program. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36640664322269 Everard Read Gallery Johannesburg Gallery

item.title: amy-ayanda-studios
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136896938205"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013939568861","gid://shopify/Product/9013939962077","gid://shopify/Product/9013940420829","gid://shopify/Product/9013940945117","gid://shopify/Product/9013941567709","gid://shopify/Product/9014041772253","gid://shopify/Product/9014041805021"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9014041772253","gid://shopify/Product/9013941567709","gid://shopify/Product/9013940945117","gid://shopify/Product/9013940420829","gid://shopify/Product/9013939962077","gid://shopify/Product/9013939568861"] amyayanda@gmail.com 0607929679 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136896938205 gid://shopify/Product/9013939568861, gid://shopify/Product/9013939962077, gid://shopify/Product/9013940420829, gid://shopify/Product/9013940945117, gid://shopify/Product/9013941567709, gid://shopify/Product/9014041772253, gid://shopify/Product/9014041805021 gid://shopify/MediaImage/36783783772381 Amy Ayanda Lester (b. 1992) is a Cape Town-based artist and musician with an Honours degree in Painting from the Michaelis School of Fine Art, UCT. Her vibrant abstract works draw inspiration from the local landscape — its flora, colours, and people — while reflecting on her family’s history of forced removal from their flower farm during Apartheid. Exploring themes of memory, loss, and beauty, Lester’s intuitive use of colour captures emotion in its immediate, playful form. In 2024, she collaborated with printmaker Roxy Kaczmarek at the David Krut Workshop, created a series of vessels with Natasha Human, and presented new works at the Latitudes Art Fair. Cape Town, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36783768535261 Amy Ayanda Studios Studios

gid://shopify/MediaImage/36786546082013 Brutal. is a contemporary project space and gallery in Cape Town, founded by Elad Kirshenbaum and Norman O’Flynn in August 2020. Born from the challenging days of the COVID-19 pandemic, Brutal. is a multi-layered platform dedicated to a dynamic mix of emerging and established artists. More than a traditional gallery, Brutal. functions as an ecosystem, offering an artist residency, a mentorship program, and artist management facilities. Central to its identity is the BLACK CUBE project space, a direct response to the conventional 'white cube.' This flexible space embraces the raw, unfiltered energy of the city, championing art that is experimental, edgy, and boundary-pushing. The gallery's philosophy acknowledges that while the world can be brutal, this reality is met with a spirit of being brutally creative, brutally positive, and brutally in love with art. Cape Town, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36786545230045 BRUTAL. Gallery

item.title: khaya-malinga
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136924791005"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013369340125","gid://shopify/Product/9013369569501","gid://shopify/Product/9014064513245"] khayakaymalinga@gmail.com gid://shopify/Metaobject/136924791005 gid://shopify/Product/9013369340125, gid://shopify/Product/9013369569501, gid://shopify/Product/9014064513245 Khaya Malinga is a multidisciplinary artist whose practice spans painting, illustration, and digital media. His work explores themes of identity, memory, and everyday South African life, often blending realism with expressive abstraction. Malinga’s art captures intimate moments and emotional depth, reflecting his interest in storytelling through colour, form, and texture. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36805189337309 Khaya Malinga Independent Artist

item.title: linathi-makanda
item.description: ["gid://shopify/Metaobject/136928723165"] ["gid://shopify/Product/9013328314589","gid://shopify/Product/9013328380125","gid://shopify/Product/9013328543965","gid://shopify/Product/9013344698589","gid://shopify/Product/9013344731357"] linathi.makanda.lm@gmail.com 0670369997 gid://shopify/Metaobject/136928723165 gid://shopify/Product/9013328314589, gid://shopify/Product/9013328380125, gid://shopify/Product/9013328543965, gid://shopify/Product/9013344698589, gid://shopify/Product/9013344731357 Linathi Makanda is a South African multidisciplinary artist from Mthatha, Eastern Cape, working across photography, fine art, and poetry. Her work explores possibility, passion, and overlooked stories, often focusing on portraiture and still life with a strong sense of vulnerability. Makanda is a member of the global Black Women Photographers community, and her photography has been recognized internationally in Vogue Italia, Color Bloc Magazine, and Cardinal Sins. Her visual project Seasons has been featured in New Plains Review and screened at the Lift-Off Online Film Festival (UK). She is also the author of the poetry collection When No One Is Watching (Odyssey Books). Port Elizabeth, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36805935169757 Linathi Makanda Independent Artist

Jackson, the STILL Artist Residency supports primary care-giving, LGBTQIA+, and African diasporic artists—particularly from the SADC region—through time, space, and financial support to create new work. Based in Johannesburg’s Ellis House Art Building, the three-month residency provides studio space, stipends, and a supportive community. Rooted in an ethos of care, reflection, and sustainability, STILL fosters collaboration, creative growth, and amplifies underrepresented voices in contemporary art. item.title: exhibitor_edition__verso
item.description: studio@editionverso.com 000-000-0000 {"customer_since":"2025-08-01 13:57:40","seller_since":"2025-08-01 14:01:34","status":"1"} edition ~ verso, founded in 2015 by master printer Sara-Aimee Verity, is a Johannesburg-based fine art print studio and publishing platform dedicated to collaboration and technical excellence. Described as a “sensitive instrument,” the studio listens, interprets, and translates artists’ ideas into print, fostering experimentation and innovation in the medium. The women-led team—Verity, Megan Rumpelt, Courteney Bentley, and Michaela Verity—works within an intimate, contemplative environment, offering a full range of printmaking techniques including intaglio, relief, collograph, chine collé, and monotype, alongside handmade paper production from studio waste. edition ~ verso has collaborated with leading artists such as Thenjiwe Nkosi, Gabrielle Goliath, Donna Kukama, Felix Shumba, and Lindokuhle Sobekwa, cultivating long-term partnerships that allow artists to explore print as an extension of their practice. The studio also runs an active internship programme, training emerging printmakers and arts professionals. Johannesburg, South Africa gid://shopify/MediaImage/36935380140253 edition ~ verso Studios

item.title: exhibitor_stephen_tapestry_studio
item.description: tina@stephenstapestrystudio.com 000-000-0000 {"customer_since":"2025-07-31 12:25:18","seller_since":"2025-07-31 12:26:32","status":"1"} Founded in the early 1960s by Coral Stephens, Stephens Tapestry Studio is South Africa’s leading hand-weaving atelier, dedicated to preserving and advancing the art of tapestry. The studio's story is one of a creative spirit passed down as a matrilineal inheretence. From the very first artistic tapestry of a Cecil Skotness woodblock, woven by Coral's daughter Marguerite Stephens, the studio expanded its collaborators to more South African and later international artists. Known for its collaborative approach, the studio works closely with artists to translate original designs into richly textured, large-scale woven works. Each tapestry is a testament to the skill, patience, and interpretive artistry of its weavers, continuing a legacy of excellence and resilience that spans over six decades. Johannesburg, South Afrca gid://shopify/MediaImage/36935411761373 Stephen Tapestry Studio Studios

item.title: lucky-me
item.description: [] njomokhethelo@gmail.com 0676094228 [] gid://shopify/MediaImage/36953253282013 Nestled in the heart of Douala, Cameroon's bustling economic and cultural capital, Logmo + Makon stands as a dynamic institution passionately dedicated to the vibrant, complex, and evolving landscape of contemporary African art. Founded with a clear vision, we are more than just a gallery; we are a dedicated champion and a nurturing platform for the artists who are defining the continent's modern creative identity. Our core mission is to seek out, support, and actively promote a diverse roster of creators, encompassing both emerging talents taking their first audacious steps and established artists whose practices have already shaped critical conversations. We are drawn to work that is intellectually rigorous and aesthetically compelling—art that refuses to be silent. The common thread connecting our artists is a profound and critical engagement with the pressing social, political, and cultural realities of our time. Their practices delve into the intricate layers of contemporary life, from the rapid pace of urbanization and the complexities of post-colonial identity to the impacts of globalization, digital transformation, and environmental change. In a world too often reliant on singular or outdated narratives about Africa, Logmo + Makon is committed to fostering the bold artistic voices that are actively shaping new, nuanced, and multifaceted perspectives. We believe in the transformative power of art to dismantle stereotypes, challenge entrenched assumptions, and fundamentally broaden the horizons of all who engage with it. We proudly position ourselves as a vital conduit—a bridge connecting the fertile ground of local creativity in Douala and across the continent with the expansive international art scene. Through thoughtfully curated exhibitions, participation in global art fairs, and strategic partnerships with institutions, we work tirelessly to ensure that the powerful stories and unique visions of our artists resonate with a global audience. Logmo + Makon is intentionally designed as a space of dialogue, intellectual exchange, and community. We transcend the traditional "white cube" model to become a gathering place for artists, collectors, curators, scholars, and art lovers to connect. Here, art becomes the catalyst for essential conversations—a universal language that builds understanding and paves the way for the future of the continent. 11 Grasmere Drive gid://shopify/MediaImage/36953252921565 Lucky + Me Gallery
